text: At Cambrinus, Bruges. Pours cloudy brown with a lasting, foamy, off-white head. The aroma contains sugar, caramel, hops, spices, raisin, dried fruit and yeast. It tastes medium sugary sweet at first, then light hoppy bitter, finishing with a winey, acidic note. Oily texture, medium body, fizzy carbonation, light alcoholic. Very complex, balancing between sweet and sour, a real tasting beer.

Bottle from Saveur biere. Pours brown with ruby red hints. Lots of dark fruit, raisin, tannic notes. Flavour is raisin sweet with a sour dry finish. Quite unusual. Lots of carbonation. Not the easiest drinking beer
Decent, but dont understand the hype. Some slightly, slightly acidic notes, a little dried fruit and some lingering bitterness.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Almost clear, rally dark ruby, gigantic beige head. Rich malty aroma, dark sugars, dried fruit, a little bit of cheesy acidity. The taste is just as rich, malty and fruity, with enough spicy bittering hops to balance, and high massging carbonation for an easy drinking mouthfeel. Background warming alcohol. Very good.

A shared bottle. Aroma: Lots of wine and dried fruit. Appearance: Huge head, dark ruby body. Taste: Very winey, fruity, phenolic, a bit tannic, lightly alcoholic. Palate: Medium-high body, high carbonation, sweet finish.

Reddish brown, high carbonation and large head. Aroma:wet hay, cherries, apples, bit of chocolate. Light body, medium sweetness, medium bitterness. Flavour; malty, dry fruits, red fruits, herbal finish. Decent hidden alcohol.

Dark brown colour, with a hugeoff white head that lasts all the time. Great lace. Aroma of dark fruits, plums, raisins. chocolate, cinnamon, nutmeg, rum. Medium to full body, creamy, dense palate. Great carbonation. Taste of chocolate, dried fruits, plums, raisins, vanilla, apples, liquor (rum). And heres another great one from the brothers. I have to find yet one that is not exceptional.
On tap at Elizabeth Station. Pours a dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is sour, fruity, some barrel notes. Taste is very fruity, caramel forward, slightly sour. Very nice.

Dark brown. Fruity, lightly spicy, and very yeasty. Notes of kandis or caramel. Strong, sweet and pungent taste that ends with a dry, pungent and boozy finish. Medium body, and foaming carbonation. Overall, a very good strong ale. A bit too pungent and boozy, though. Not as drinkable as Arabier.

Aroma of Chocolate and spices.Appearance is black as night. Taste Chocolate and licorice. Palate . medium body, moderate feel, average carbonation. Overall would have gotten a perfect rating if i didnt get small amounts of alcohol burn. Besides that a great belgian strong ale.

0.33 l bottle from drankgigant.nl, best before February 2017, cellared for almost two years. Foam streams slowly out of the bottle... Clear, very dark reddish brown with a massive, foamy, very dense, stable, off-white head. Sweetish, moderately fruity, slightly vinous and a bit yeasty-spicy aroma of caramel, raisins, figs, red grapes and oak. Sweetish, a bit sourish, malty, moderately fruity and quite yeasty-spicy taste of caramel, red grapes, oak, marzipan, candied cherries and a touch of chocolate, followed by a medium long, slightly bitter, dry, a little tart and a bit warming-alcoholic finish. Medium body, heavily effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Very tasty and really complex, almost refreshing with that sourish, typical De Dolle yeast touch. The excessive carbonation is quite annoying again though, this almost needs to be decanted as most of their beers.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. For the book. Vintage 2016. Aroma is dark fruit, caramel, spices, maybe some clove, wood, good. Appearance is brown, light tan head, mostly hazy. Taste is dark fruit, woody, caramel, spice, some robust alcohol. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, really bubbly but not spritzy, dark fruit and woody dry aftertaste. Overall, this is real good.
33cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bières. Notes de fruits mûrs et de caramel.

Murky prune brown reddish colour. Off-white head with nice head retention. A tad alcohol, great belgian yeasty taste. Interesting aftertaste, almost like marmite & veggie mite flavours. Smell of dark fruits. A real sipper.
Dark brown pour with a massive tan head. Malty body, cloves, spice... Bread and yeast... Slightly tart finish. Decent.

Birra di marrone scuro con riflessi di rame. Schiuma fine e persistente. Allolfatto aromi erbacei e fruttati. Al palato il corpo è rotondo, sentori di frutta come prugna e susine, bilanciate da note di liquirizia. Unottima birra.
Wow. Virkelig en god belgisk ale. Tilpas med sødme og bitterhed, En rimelig kraftig øl, med høj alkoholprocent.

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2017 From Belgium in a box; dark brown to almost black, huge slightly offwhite head; aroma is sweet, dark sugar, clove, nutmeg, some grainy maltiness, some alcohol; taste is chocolate, coffee, dark sugar, medium sweetness, bitter roasty finish, quite dry; thin refreshing mouthfeel with high carbonation and thin body [tasted 17.2.17, best before may 2017]

Bottle. Reddish Brown. Dark bitter chocolate predominates with a slightly sour edge. Malty, sweet caramel. Dark-fruits, cherries, apples. Spicy, peppery, yeasty, Long, dry, spicy, sour finish. Very complex. Terrific beer! (2008)

Color marrón, entre claro y oscuro (con reflejos rojizos), pantanoso, opaco, con capa de espuma de un blanco sucio de cuatro dedos de grosor (textura jabonosa y muy buena retención; al final se convierte en islas de espuma y en un anillo blanquecino que se pega a las paredes de la copa). Carbonatación a tope (más presente visualmente que en boca). Aroma a alcohol (recuerda a algún vino), dark fruits, especias, chocolate, caramelo, ¿quizá azúcar moreno? Sabor que sigue al aroma, dulce, con dark fruits por un tubo (así como un deje ácido que no llega a desarrollarse del todo), buena dosis de alcohol (sin que llegue a echar patrás) y un poco de amargor final. Pocas Belgian Strong Ales tan complejas y sabrosas como esta. La botella que he probado tenía tres años, me encantaría probar una botella fresca para poder comparar, aunque es probable que toda la complejidad extra haya sido adquirida en botella con el paso del tiempo debido a la levadura salvaje que estos locos utilizan. Se la recomendaría incluso a un abstemio si fuera necesario.
Bottle 33 cl, pours a Brown colour with a foamy beige head, aroma of dried fruits, Sweet taste of dried fruits and alcohol. Dry finish with notes of alcohol.

F: huge, pale brown, good retention.
C: dark brown to black, opaque.
A: dark malt, chocolate, figs, dates, overripe red grapes, banana, raisins, caramel, port wine, yeast.
T: you have to be quick, cause of the foam coming out of the bottle really fast, malt, port wine, chocolate, cacao, coffee, raisins, dark dried fruits, candy sugar, spicy, full body, medium to high carbonation, very tasty, good balanced beer from this style, worth to try, BB: 09/2016, 0,33l bottle from Prik&Tik Kampenhout.

250ml bottle @Pułapka Gdańsk 
Aroma of dried fruit, spices and molasses. 
Very creamy and thick off white head over a bit hazy dark brown body
Sweet taste, dried fruit, bread, spiciness, some caramel and alcohol in the finish
Medium body though with nice sticky slick feeling on the tongue
Very tasty classical Belgian beer.

Opaque dark brown with thick lasting beige, foamy, dense head. Aroma is caramel malts, candy sugar, dried plums, berries and soap aromas. Taste starts with sweetish strong alcohol and finishes dry. Plum brandy, red fruits. Metallic notes probably due to the crystal malts used. Heavy body, average carbonation, dry alcoholic finish. Good beer, but the alcoholic backbone is a bit too pronounced.
Deep brown pour with orange tints, nice big off-white head. Aroma of lychee, strawberry, and dried fruits. Flavor of figs, dates, with vinous notes. Very, very nice.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2017 In der Nase unerwarteterweise nicht viel los. Ein Hauch Malz und Seifenaromen lassen sich erschnuppern. Optisch brennt nichts an. Dunkelbraun, fast undurchsichtig und mit einer hellbraunen, gut haltbaren Schäumung, versehen. Nett. Der Trunk dann gehobene BSA Kategorie. Cremig und garstig. Trockenobstig und verbrannt karamelig. Der Abgang säuerlich, wärmend alkoholisch und zusätzlich kratzig bitter. Cool!!! 0,33/3,50. Bottle. BEYOND BEER HH.Eupdorisiert nach dem WESTVLETEREN 12 Tasting : 8/4/8/5/18 Edler BSAer mit kratziger Freshness. Redfruitkupfersäurer aus jugendlicher Leidenschaft. Bready Motherfucker ✨👽👌.
Fantástica cerveza. Buena presencia y retención, aroma a frutos secos, especias y frutos rojos. En boca lo mismo pero con toques dulces a caramelo.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Znakomity klasyczny Belg. Suszone owoce, melasa, czekolada.

At the Jealous Monk, Mystic. The aroma is fruit, berries, tart cherries, wood. The appearance is dark red, thin head. The flavor is tart fruit, light booze, bread. The finish is light booze, tart fruit. Medium in body. Good overall.

Very dark brown and reddish color with quite thick light brown head. Aroma is a bit tart and has ripe fruits, brown sugar, berries, cherries. Taste is malty with long fruity and a bit sour and dry aftertaste. Flavors of cherries, ripe fruits, berries, malt, red wine, some sour elements, caramel and chocolate. Nice combination of sour and sweet elements.

Bouteille avec un BB de juillet 2017. Robe brune sale surmontée dun titanesque col de mousse blanchâtre et onctueux qui ne cesse de croître. Arômes de levures belges, soupçon de baies confites, malt caramelisé, raisins secs, sirop de poire. En bouche, malt caramelisé, mûres confites, raisins rouges séchés, levures âcres, cacao, sucre brun. Quelques notes grillées et de fruits du verger. Texture onctueuse, presque veloutée et corps moyen.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Dense ruby body with a thin beige head. Good lacing. Aroma of cinnamon, apple pie, caramel and blueberry. Flavour of sour cherry and red apple. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Lively fizz. Theres an unusual sour note but its a nice sipper.

Dégustée dans un verre Straffe Hendrik: jolie robre brune surmontée dune belle mousse crème évoquant déjà la douceur à venir par sa texture veloutée!La carbonatation est intense et les arômes laissent apparaître des notes maltées et houblonnées avec une légère amertume mêlée à lalcool.La bouche nous amène sur un merveilleux velouté nous offrant des saveurs à limage du nez avec une petite pointe dacidité relevant cet ensemble très riche.La finale nous fait rester sur une douce chaleur infinie....Une bière dexception comme les Rochefort et Pannepot!..19/20

Dégustée dans un verre Straffe Hendrik.
Température de début 11 à 12°.
Très belle robe brun sombre surmontée dune très abondante et persistante mousse ivoire; carbonatation intense.
Nez très riche avec des arômes houblonnés et de pain, des notes acides et fruitées le tout dans un bel équilibre.
Le goût est tout aussi harmonieux et complexe : fruits rouges qui apportent lacidité, vieux vin cuit(Porto) pour la douceur et une discrète touche amère.
La finale est longue et très plaisante sur la chaleur de lalcool et la douceur.
Une bière dexception tout simplement délicieuse.
19/20

Color tonaca di frate con cappello di schiuma finissima e pannosa,beige, dalla lunga tenuta. Al naso frutta rossa sottospirito e legno. Lieve caramello. Corpo ben strutturato e carbonazione molto fine e bassa. Sorso pieno e vellutato. Al palato melassa, frutta rossa sottospirito, prugna r dattero appassiti. Alcol presente. Ancora caramello.

Hazy brown. Tall ivory head. Perfect retention. Candy, caramel, dried fruit, pear, spicy yeast on nose. Medium to full body. High carbo. Nicely balanced. Lovely spicy yeast, caramel, toffee, candy, just right amount of hops. Alco absolutely away. Splendid-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

0.33 l bottle @ Akkurat, Stockholm. Red-Brown or black depending on the lighting, big head. Dark sweet malts with a sour ending. Tastes like a red dessert wine, which is not just sweet. Not as sour as the Flander oud bruin style, though. Nice for a dessert.

Almost black with ruby highlights. Aroma of treacle, liquorice, sasparilla. Very intriguing. Taste lighter than youd expect. Notes of chocolate, dark fruit, dark caramel, and loads of liquorice that carries into the palate. Very nice.
Very dark ruby, brownish colour. Huge beige head. Aroma of dark fruits, caramel, dark sugar, marshmellow. Taste is medium sweet. Medium body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Very impressive head.

Problem of not taking notes during the session.
Will have to try it again and do a "proper tasting"

Not too much aroma, but generally yeasty. Lots of phenols in the taste, some bitter and a touch of sour notes, grapefruit, citrus peel. Starts sweet, finishes bitter and boozy. Lot of alcohol taste. I wasnt super impressed.
Dried fruits, toffee, spices, yeast, a bit acetic, dark reddish with a good beige foam, medium body, medium carbonation, quite sweet, dried fruits and toffee again...i very appreciate this beer.

Pours opaque dark brown, nearly black, with a gigantic three-finger beige head that lasts a long time. Thin layer of fine yeast sediment is present at the bottom. With that huge head, it brings aromas of fresh apples (honeycrisp), baking spice, roasted malts, & some caramel. Arrives spicy with a mixture of apples (sweet and tart). Malty & roasty middle. Finishes candy sweet (chocolate/caramel) and of course with a kick of alcohol. Lively on the palate without carbonation taking over; medium-bodied, finished long, and surprisingly hot with alcohol at 9%. It doesnt hide the ABV that well and certainly tastes/feels like its in the range of 12-13%.

Bottle. Solid malty sweetness, burned sugar, caramel, dried fruits, light vinous aroma, alcohol prezent but it is mellowed and quite pleasant. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture. Finish is sweetish and bit alcoholic.
Bottle. Slightly blurred. Aroma: sweet malt, plum wine, toffees, candies, wine. Taste: light sweetness, malt, toffee, fortified wine, yellow plum.

33cl bottle. Dark caramel pour with a tall and lively tan head with good retention. Notes of coffee, chocolate, raisins, figs, spices - rosemary, coriander - cola and Belgian yeast. Medium body, high carbonation and a bitter-sweet finish.
[backlog] 30-01-16 // bottle. Deep red brown colour, big beige head. Strong malty sweetness. Belgium yeast, dark fruits, like plums, light alcolohic aftertaste.

Draft. Orange/pineapple, caramel malt, and light hay aroma. Golden yellow with nice head. Very sweet orange/pineapple, caramel malt, and moderately bitter grapefruit peel flavor. Nice body and balance. Excellent - not sure how I missed this for so long.

Tap into a wineglass showing red wine with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose is tart and acetic with hints of blackberries. 

The palate is lightly carbonated and medium bodied. Very light flavors of dark fruit (plums, blackberries, cassis) and a light bitterness on the finish.

Cherry wood brown with huge 2 finger lite tan head. Sticky lacing lingers for a long time. A little cloudy from a crappy pour.

Initial aroma reminds me a very watered down Supplication. Next is dry slightly floral and pungent ... Nuttiness fades to an almost dry amaretto aroma. Pepper low coriander and finishes with an unexpected Belgian yeast spiceness and maybe a little bit of tartness. Very unique and flowing flavors .... spices and fruit meld to yeast fruitiness ending with a dry tart finish.
Bottle at Poechenellekelder. Rich plum character with a jam feel, some porto wine quality, great finish. Definitely a classic with a dangerously hidden abv.
Pour Dark Brown with a fine White head. Banana caramel and Bread. Taste. Light sweet bitter. Average carbonation
Tap. Pours murky reddish dark brown with a big brown head. Aromas of belgian yeast, dark fruits, orange, caramel, chocolate, malts. Taste is sweet, dark fruits, yeasty, caramel, dark sugar.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Aroma of slight burnt caramel, dark dried fruits, raisins, vinous, caramel. Dark brown colour with off-white head, mostly lasting. Taste is light+ sweet and light+ malt bitter. Full body, oily feel, vinous caramel finish.
Pours a deep chestnut with an off white head. Strong dark fruits aroma. Strong boozy taste.

Bottle. Very dark brown and reddish color with quite thick light brown head. Aroma is a bit tart and has ripe fruits, brown sugar, berries, cherries, sour apple. Taste is malty with long fruity and a bit sour and dry aftertaste. Flavors of cherries, ripe fruits, berries, malt, red wine, some sour elements, caramel and chocolate. Nice combination of sour and sweet elements.

Color tonaca di frate, con ampia schiuma beige compatta e di buona persistenza. Al naso il malto risalta insieme alle spezie, note di frutta secca e dark fruits. Eccellente la bevuta, piena, dolce con una bella speziatura. Alcol che sostiene la bevuta fino alla fine alla perfezione. Buona anche una leggera amarezza finale. Carbonazione medio alta. Una grande strong ale.
Pours dark brown with a huge brown head. Aroma is malt, chocolate, coffee and some spices. Taste is medium to high sweet.

Bottle. Its been quite some time since I last had it. Nose is yeast, cherry, dark fruits, caramel, brown sugar, plums, fig, spice, bread. Taste is dark chocolate, cherry, hint of cola, caramel, dark fruits, vinous, cinamon, dry licorice, slight sour note, a dry herbal hop note in the finish with heavy spices. Mouthfeel is rich. 

An outstanding big Belgian, which pulls off the trick of being full bodied, full flavoured, but not overly sweet. The hints of sour with a the dry finish lift the beer from great to outstanding.
Draft at Rustico Alexandria. Poured a medium dark brown color with a small tan head. Aroma was dark, dried fruits. Light sweet, fizzy funky yeast notes. Bold, but still refreshing.

Do tap. Marrom-avermelhada, opaca, espuma de boa formação. Aroma de frutas escuras (ameixa, uva), carregado de leveduras e um toque leve de malte. O sabor acompanha o aroma, com menos levedura e mais doce. O final é levemente picante, um pouco tostado. Carbonatação média, suave para beber, quase não se nota a presença do álcool. Ótima experiência.

Acquired via trade with Chopz. 300ml bottle. Bottle cap says bottled 2012. Pours a huge frothy beige head and has an extremely murky brown appearance. Lacing is kinda weak. Aromas of roasted barley malts, dried fruits (raisins, plums) and spices. Flavours are plentiful malty, dark roasted malt, chocolate, spices. Alcohol is quite evident and actually a bit overwhelming. 9% but maybe a bit more now. The finish is very dry and tastes very much like prunes or prune juice.

On tap at the Trappist. It pours an amber color with an off white head. The aroma has some fruitcake, baked bread, brown sugar and light notes of clove spice. The flavor is spicy with more clove up front, cinnamon, chili powder and fruitcake. High carbonation and really lively on the palate. Good.

Dark hazy, strong beige head.

Aroma: dark sweet fruits (prunes, figs), warming spices.
Taste: sweet with prunes sourness and wild notes.
Flavour: dried figs, dried dates, prunes, black pepper, allspice, nutmeg.
Finish is spicy, warming, with pleasant alcohol notes.

Very good.

Tra il rosso rubino e il tonaca di frate, schiuma beige di persistenza esemplare.
Aroma fruttato fantastico: banana matura, pesca, pera, mela cotta e prugna, lievi note vinose ed oleose, lievito belga, note tostate ed erbacee.
Al palato principalmente banana, mela e pera, lievito belga, finale tostato, un po "cioccolatoso" ed erbaceo accompagnato da note vinose e legnose.
Corpo pieno, ben carbonata.

Spina @ scurreria.
Marrone scuro con bella schiuma.
Bevuta un pò fredda, comunque si sentiva un bel corpo e frutta matura

Cieszylem się z ostatniego wysypu belgów, a tu kolejne przegazowane (w zamyśle niewłaściwie przechowywane i/lub stare) piwo. Gushing totalny. Chociaż połowa ocalała. Aromat zdominowany przez cukiuer kandyzowany, zioła, karmel i utlenienie. Do tego karmel i owoce - śliwki i winogrona. Barwa rubinowa, zamglona, z wymuszoną, beżową pianą, która choć obfita szybko opada. Smak słodki z nutą kwaskową i alkoholową. W tle karmel, chleb, suszone owoce, melano. Goryczka - o dziwo - zaznaczona, choć tylko lekko drażniąca i przyjemna. Krągła pełnia, zdecydowanie wysokie wysycenie i kwaskowo- słodowy finisz z akcentem alkoholowym, rozgrzewającym przełyk. Pełnowartościowe mogłoby być niezłe.
Attractive ruby amber with big Fluffy frothy lasting tan head. Sweet. Caramel. Brown sigat. Fruity. Alcohol. Not too spicy. Rich. Very enjoyable.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka z KiK, warka do zamazane, ale raczej swiezutka. Kosmicznie wysoka piana, choc niezbyt piekna jesli idzie o strukture, bardzo ciemny bursztynowy kolor piwa. aromaty to glownie swieze ciemne owoce (bardzo intensywne), suszone ciemne owoce (w tym rodzynki), lekki karmel... w sumie niewiele wiecej. To co czuc ma o dziwo wydzwiek kwaskowaty dzieki owocom (wisnie, czerwone porzeczki). Czuc tez nieco alko w stylu porto oraz lekka przyprawowosc belgijska. W ustach najpierw czuc bardzo wysokie, szczypiace wysycenie, warto nalewac z rozmachem ;) dalej faktycznie wyrazna kwaskowatosc i troche slodkosci. Generalnie tez powtorka aromatow. niewiele ciala. jak na taki ekstrakt i alkohol - jest bardzo rzeskie. jest bardzo dobre, niemniej przyznam sie, ze to nie moj kierunek BSDA, smakuje to jak imperial dubel ;) wiec jak na piwo z top50 to troche rozczarowanym...Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle at NH hotel room in Brussels. Caramel, vanilla, cinnamon and dark fruits. Strong and flavourful, slightly christmasy. Very very tasty.

Pours opaque almost-black with a huge beige head which lingers for a while. Aroma is caramel, burnt sugar, ash, blackcurrants. Taste is molasses sweet, some chocolate sweetness, a hint of dark berry tartness,caramel sweet. Full bodied with a creamy feel.

Bottle. Beer Stop, Dronfield. Hazy, dark ginger colour. Film, and ring of beige head. Nose has baked brown sugar. Sweet fruits, dates and such. Light tang of vine fruits. Taste is fruity sweet. Some tangy bitterness. Doesnt feel the ABV. Way too much fizz, for me. Finish is tangy, lasting, fruity bitter.
Mahognifarget klar med høyt tykt beige skum. Lukter lett brent karamell. Fyldig. Søt, lett brent karamell. Lite bitterhet. Alkoholen kjennes godt. Noe stikky.

duft: sødlig lidt karamel lidt kokus agtig
smag: karamel. sødlig svag krydret

Bottle at home (from Alus Celle Riga).
Aroma: fancy caramel, sweet, bread, malty, a little spicy, fruit notes. Really nice. Golden-amber with big grey-ish head color. Something very familiar from glass, but I cant remember.
Body is creamy, caramel, quite thick, ethereal. Medium sweet (a bit more). Tart and some medicine notes in the finish. Amazing.

From a bottle. Looks great, a dark, with a shade of red appearance.
Nice thick ivory head. Chocolate, alcohol, roasted coffee in the nose.
Taste is beautiful, coffee, toffee, chocolate, roasty malts, A nice bitter aftertaste.
Really great.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33cl bottle, served in tulip glass. Poured a chestnutty red brown with a huge 4 finger ivory head. Waited a while for the head to dissipate to get to the aroma. Aromas of cherries, malty sweetness, apple, and later when getting more to room temperature the aromas keep developing, there is chocolate with dark fruits and raisins and plums. Taste is amazing! Cherries, vanilla, caramel, apricots, apple pie, toasted bread with jam, plums, raisins, molasses, licorice. Very vinous. Sour but not overwhelming. And it gets even better when getting more to room temperature. Awesome whats going on in my mouth here! The malty sweetness is kicking in with chocolate, coffee and tart now...WOW! What a complex brew this is, it keeps on developing. Its hard to believe with what Im drinking right now  that Oerbier tasted even better with the Rodenbach yeast in the past so now I got to taste some of these earlier brews as a comparison. I am going to follow up the brewers advice and cellar a lot of these and enjoy one every year to mark its development over the years. Overall a sensational brew, a full body with a slightly dry, creamy, sticky tart finish. Bravo Dolle Brouwers!! And thank you for the experience...

Pale yellow color. Nice white medium head. Flowery aroma. Hints of yeast. A bit caramelly at first. Bitter in the middle. Bitter, even herbal finish. Very well balanced, medium carbonated, well drinable, rather medium bodied beer, but stil light then considering the abv.

Dark brown colored, ruby hue, medium beige frothy head, unclear. Aroma is of brown sugar, dried fruits, bit tartish vinous, some toasted notes. Taste is medium to very sweet brown sugar, dried fruits, some spices, bit tart and winy, some toast, quite fruity, light+ spicy bitterness. Medium to full bodied, soft+ carbonation, bit creamy.
(bottle from the brewery)

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 dark, murky brown beer, with plenty of beige foam. Aroma of malt, caramel, dark fruit and vanilla. Brett some fresh yeast. creamy on the palate, with malty taste with hints of molasses, candy, cake, again dark fruit, ripe plums spices and yeast. Something dry and sour at the end, with some connotation of red wine. In fact there is a special edition wine aged in barrels of Bordeaux. Alcohol well integrated.

L:
-pours a cloudy ruby-brown with a big,foamy,beige head
-medium to high carbonation visible
S:
-sour cherries,strawberries,woody,caramel,chocolate,herb cherries,chocolate,cognac
-slight sourness
-slight bitterniss
F:
-high,offensive carbonation
-light to medium body
-boozy
O:
Taste is pretty good,but the ridiculous amount of carbonation makes this undrinkable.
Not gonna repeat

Aroma:

Malts, caramel, yeast and fruit.

Appearance:

Turbid ruby/brown beer with a huge light brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Heavy sweet with malts, caramel, yeast and fruit.
330ml bottle. Hazy copper with a thick frothy khaki head. Flavors are yeast, alcohol, molasses, caramel, cough syrup, nuts, dark fruits, earthy notes. Full body, good carbonation, creamy texture.

Sample at Winking Lizard. Cloudy amber color with a medium fluffy white head that dissipates gradually. Small patches of lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, yeast and malt. Medium to full body with flavors of ripe fruit, earthy yeast and grainy malt. The finish is fruity with a cherry and fig aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
Veel schuim bij het inschenken. Donkere kleur. Nogal zoet, kalishesmaak. Licht verteerbaar, maar keert er van om.

Bottle at home. Pours cherry-red with a large off-white head. Aroma of fruits, spices, hops and nuts. Taste is pretty much like the aroma but also with flavours of caramel and molasses. Full body and very active carbonation. Bitter and fruity finish. Awesome. Ive had this one many times - even at the brewery and it never dissapoints. Love it.

Bottle. Pours a really dark brown with a fading beige bubble head. Aroma of chocolate, nuts, dark fruits, figs, blackcurrant, spice. Taste is of nuts, toffee, wood, figs, brown sugar, spice on the finish. Medium carbonation, light oily mouthfeel.

Bottle at home. Bought at Plan B. Cap reads >MAY2017. Pours dark brown with huge fluffy cream/tan head. Roasted sweet malt, oily, melasse, licorice stick, spices, nutty, piney, yeast and during the second half of my glass dough, spring onion and lemongrass, aromas keep on opening up! Amazing! Theres blueberries in the muffin dough. I feel like Im fucking stoned. Chocolate and mint coming in now. Taste is moderate sweet and below moderate bitter, yeastiness keeps sweet and bitter compact and adds a tart finish. Body is full and texture is slick, thick and oily. Carbo is spikey but activity is average. Very nice beer! And NAT & STRAF indeed, drinks easy, will get you tripping. Reminds me of certain members from the Rochefort family.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. A Belgian Strong on the sugary-candy side of the spectrum. Despite the heavy malts, theres still a lot of hops in this one. The carbonization is very sparkly, making it - despite all the sweetness - quite easy to drink.

Draft @ De Dolle. Shared with the UnPer100 crew.
Brune foncée, col beige tenace.
Arôme est plaisant et assez envoutant, sort un peu du lot des bières brunes belges. Ici un accent est mis sur le malt, retrouve pas mal de chocolat, fruité noir perce en rétro accompagné dune fine pointe de réglisse.
Palais est enclin à bien mettre laccent sur les 9% de cette bière, retrouve un profil chaleureux, bien garnit au niveau des malts, chocolaté, grillé, caramel, le tout conserve un léger côté épicé qui perdure et sans être dominant est un élément important de cette version. Ce dernier sapparente à la réglisse. Une classique du style qui se laisse déguster.

Botella. del @Coalla Gourmet, Oviedo. 05/01/2016 Bottled: 04/14
Color marron, aroma caramelo, pasas, sabor dulce, notas especiadas, muy agradable.

Ok, jai affaire ici à une bière dont le profil ne mest pas familier. La bière est brune et se gonfle de mousse de manière chaotique et démesurée lors du service. Je dois être très prudent! Cette mousse ne tient pas vraiment cependant et en peu de temps, elle nest plus quun souvenir. Lorsque japproche le verre de mon nez, je suis frappé par des arômes sûres et violentes. Rien à voir avec le profil des bières sûres sauvages classiques. Non, lattaque est pourrie. Cependant, une fois cette attaque passée, de douces saveurs de fruits se développent doucement sous mes narines intriguées et admiratives. Un prune fabuleuse se marie a une cerise noire qui sont accompagnées de fruits plus délicats telles la clémentine et le noyau dabricot. Un nez prodigieusement complexe! En bouche, une effervescence beaucoup trop agressive pour moi vient gâter la dégustation car je peine réellement à laisser couler le liquide dans ma bouche sans heurts. Beaucoup dalcool je dois le mentionner, mais au-delà de ces deux défauts (importants pour moi cela dit) le liquide est aussi complexe quil létait au nez il y a à peine un instant. Une texture moelleuse supporte une quantité fulgurante de fruits noirs et confits. Un jus de dattes et de pruneaux (sans ses effets relâcheurs je lespère!) maturé avec savoir, sagesse et intelligence. Le fruit confit, lorange et une fraise. Jaurais sans doute pu donner une note parfaite à cette bière si ça navait pas été des deux importants défauts mentionnés plus haut. Peut-être ma bouteille a-t-elle mal vieilli? Il faudra que je déguste à nouveau car je suis visiblement ici devant un produit dexception.
Good aroma, and particulary good taste. It goes well with Arabiers pâté and spanish jam.
Sour and sweet aroma. The same for the taste. Cloudy and non transparent. Sweet aftertaste
Amber hazy with small white head. Sweet aroma with sour notes. Sweetsour honey like taste, well balanced, followed by good bitter note. Bitter aftertaste.

Bottle bbe sep 2016. Aroma mild, molasses, ripe fruits. Taste fruits, acid, hint of licourice, dry. Finishes with some chocolate roastiness and sweetness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Oerbier 13 vintage, consumed 151228

Pours a dark brown color with ember hints in it, revealing a giant, spongy head.

Smells of spicy wheat, wood bark and rock sugar. Although it inherits a gentle sweetness, the beer got an earthy, almost oaken balance to it, featuring ripe red grapes and tart dextrose. 

Has a higher, lively carbonation to it, wrapping up the sweetness with a bubbly, metallic carbonation.

Tastes of older, caramel soaked malts, topped off by fermented grapes, a decent sourness and rock sugar on top. Toffee turns more profound among the bubbly carbonation, coming up after the swallow, thinning the profound earthiness a bit, while maintaining its balance. Finishes clean, with a sour note among rock sugar and caramel, while the carbonation dies down to a likeable minimum.

While it certainly features a well pronounced maltiness, the beers sweetness defines the overall taste of this beer. It doesnt turn cloyingly sweet, due to the beers convincing balance, while it certainly lacks an appealipng depth of flavors to me, prevented by the omnipresent sweetness.
Zwaar bier, traag te drinken, een volle smaak in de mond. Wel een goede schuimkraag.

Piana obfita, średnio oczkowa, sycząca, ale dość długo pozostaje w postaci pierzynki. Barwa mahoniowa, mętna. W aromacie lekka kwaśność czerwonych owoców (wiśnia, porzeczka, czereśnia), są też suszone owoce i winogron a w tle delikatna stajnia. Przyjemny i orzeźwiający. W smaku jest dość słodko i jednocześnie cierpko, konkretna karmelowa podstawa, kandyzowane owoce, rodzynki, suszona morela, po chwili pojawia się niewielka kwaśność czerwonego wina, delikatna dzikość oraz miła choć długa, głogowo pikantna goryczka. W afterteasie czerwony pieprz i prażone migdały. Wysokie nagazowanie, chwilę musujące w ustach jak szampan. Lekko szorstkie, ziemiste i sycące w odbiorze. Alkohol rozgrzewający, ładnie wkomponowany, odpowiedni do woltażu. 
Dość nietypowe piwo w porównaniu do klasyków stylu, przez co ciekawe. Fermentacja spontaniczna dodała fajnych nut w aromacie i delikatnie podkręciła smak...

Ruby brown with large frothy tan head. Aromas of dried dates and figs, toffee, some alcohol. The taste is well balanced between sweetness and bitterness - plums, cherries, dates, dark candi sugar, some vinous notes, acidity and sour hints. Full bodied and lively on the tongue. Very interesting and enjoyable belgian strong.

W aromacie zaskakująco mało się dzieje, karmel, przyprawy, nieco suszonych owoców, mało intensywnie. W smaku raczej wytrawne, suszone owoce, karmel, na finiszu fajnie odkłada się kakao, co jest najmocniejszym punktem tego piwa. Nieco kwaskowe, przez co raczej pijalne. Brakuje treści, alkohol rozgrzewa, ale nie irytuje. Niezłe piwo, ale oczekiwania były wyższe.

heb er een oud mijn oude voorraad gedronken, houdbaarheid op de fles 1998 !
Smaak is zurig, wijnachtig, heerlijk

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 Bottle from Belgian Beer Factory. Pours dark brown, nice smooth light brown head. Nose is caramel and brown sugar, dried fruits, some alcohol. Taste has lots of dried fruits, plums, lightly roasted malts, brown sugar, some bitterness, liquorice, sour and vinous notes, alcohol warming. Complex but still easy to drink. Excellent.

Robe brune reflets ambrés. Nez sur les épices, le malt, le caramel, la levure. Bouche à lattaque acidulée, fraîche, épicée, belle structure et longue finale acidulée et amère. Une bière puissante que je serai curieux de regoûter avec un an de cave.

33cl bottle. Murky reddish brown, huge light beige. Aroma is very good, sweet and fruity with some light chocolate and butter notes. Taste is even better, wine notes, red fruits, some roastiness. Excellent.

Bottle. Hazy, dark red brown. Aroma has fruity malt, yeast and bananas, evident alcohol. Dried fruit flavour, caramel, warming alcohol and some sour notes well balanced by the sweetness. Creamy mouthfeel, tickling carb. Lovely BSA.

Bottle, pours dark brown with a beige head. Slightly sour aroma with a bit of barnyard, somehow not fitting. Taste is completely different. Lots of dark cherries, dates, plums, dusty hay, castor sugar, cocoa, sweet overripe apples. Sweet, nice bitterness, light sourness, lively carbonation, light vinous. Odd one.
Zwart bier met schuim. Smaak is bitter hoppig en krachtig, licht zuur met iets van caramel, bittere chokolade, rook en zuur fruit. Verder sporen van anijs. Geslaagd bier.

0.33l bottle. Hazy reddish dark brown body, light brown head. Aroma of caramel, reisins, champagne yeast and some cherries and a hint of chocolate. Taste of caramel, cocoa, cherries, orange zest, champagne yeast and floral hops. High carbonation, light-medium body. Very nice beer.
Bottle at home. Pours brown reddish. Aroma of yeast, light sour, malty, kinda sweet. Taste is vinous, sour fruit, yeasty, fun balance. Kinda unique starting sour and vinous getting quit sweet.

For me this is up there with pannepot and rochefort. Nice murky brown with a good tan head and lively carbonation. It has it all: sweet, tart and bitter. Rich full flavor of cacao dried fruits marzipan and cider. The alcohol is warming but it is not boozy. If you like the style it is a must. Delicious.

Donkerrood/bruin bier met rijke beetje mokkakleurige schuimkraag die snel wegebt. Bier ruikt beetje naar kriek. Zurig aroma, je ruikt ook beetje hout. Bier smaakt redelijk vol en zwaar. Cider, bruin suiker, pruimen, vijgen. Lekkere, licht moutige afdronk. Niet te koud drinken.

330ml bottle. Dark copper brown color with red notes and light beige head. Malty aroma, caramel, dark fruits, wood, wineous, light spicy. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with average carbonation.
Dark colour with a yellow creamy head which lingers.Fruit cake flavour with a spicy undertone. Delicious -- rated with beerbasher/winphone
4 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey, consumed on 9/11/2015. Dark brownish with beige head. Aromas of dark fruit, caramel. Tastes of dark fruit, caramel, spices. Medium body with a dry finish.

bottled April 14; a whole range of sugars in aroma: crumbly, milky fudge, slightly burned caramels, marshmallow, dates, and sort of a grape sugary metallic edge. Taste sets on subtle, with almost British herbal-fragrant caramels before showiing its pushy Granny liqueur, Cognacbohnen and hot-chocolate-with-Grand-Marnier fizzy fuzzy heart. Maybe will get better with age?

Bottle at home, 26th September 15. Pours a fluffy head, dark beer. Aroma is rich, dark sugar, fruit, slight liquorice. Taste is sweetish, brown sugar, dried fruit, slight spice, pretty taste and enjoyable

Den Haag, Rootz 25-09-2015 met Lou

Dolle Brouwers Oerbier. 

Verassende smaak. Ruikt naar kriek en schenkt ook rode gloed maar smaakt heel anders. Flinke schuimkraag, donkere kleur en bruisende smaak. Ruikt zoet en smaakt fris. Echte aanrader!

dark mahogany-brown colour, huge, forever lasting beige-ish head; aroma of dried plum, date, liqueur notes, some roastedness, chocolate, maybe tart and hints of vanilla; taste of date, and other dried fruits, some chocolate and liqueur notes, as well as roastedness; great Belgian strong ale
Drinking this beer for more then 30 years: Visited the brewery when they brewed in a bathtub ....
Bottle. Hazy reddish brown color with beige head. Aroma of apple, oak and berries. A bit too sweet taste.

Una birra praticamente vicinissima alla perfezione, tutto ciò che desidero da una Belgian Strong Dark Ale (o Quadruppel, che dir si voglia). Colore marrone brandy scuro, schiuma beige con riflessi dorati, abbondante, fine e decisamente persistente. Al naso e in bocca sentori del loro ottimo lievito, caramellosi, speziati, fruttati, cioccolato, leggero tostato, uva passa, liquoroso. Corpo decisamente strutturato e carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa. Cosa desiderare di più?

2015/09/07 - Pours a hazy, brown mahogany with a foamy, khaki head that slowly reduces. Aroma is brown sugar, mild molasses, caramel, dates, plums, raisins, light fruitcake and mild flowery tones. Taste is caramel, dried dark fruits, fruitcake spices, tart dark fruit, mild licorice and moderate red wine notes. Mouthfeel is medium and silky with biting carbonation and slightly tart, drying finish. Very nice and dangerously drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle @ home. Murky brownish pour with a huge frothy head. Notes of figs, dark dried fruits, toasted nuts, roast, caramel and some light vanilla.

Bottle. Aroma is berries, caramel, fudge, dark fruits, dried dark fruits. Taste is light berriness, caramel is strong as are dark fruits and dried dark fruits. Dates and prune. Liquorice. Carbonation is pretty strong.
Reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma of fruit, malt, caramel, nuts, wood and molasses. Taste is mild sweet, mild bitter and light acidic.

Draught, cask at the GBBF 2015 (London Olympia) on 14-Aug-2015. Clear dark brown colour with a decent sized tan coloured head. Medium to heavy body and light to medium carbonation. Aroma of malt and dark fruits. Flavour of fruit, caramel, molasses - the sweetness of the fruit is followed by a tartness and bitter finish. Pretty good.
Fluffig und perlend, dabei angenehm im Hopfen mit einem guten Schuss Hefe. Dazu etwas Nuss und Vanille. Klassisches belgisches mit einer milden und leicht würzigen Note.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund.The beer has got a cloudy light amber colour with a steady head and smooth body. Aroma of Belgian yeast and flowers. Taste of Belgian yeast, flowers, soap, bread, cake, malt, perfume and straw. Grainy, sweet malty hints. Big Belgian touch. Average Belgian beer.
Bruin, helder bier. Kruiden, mout, caramel, chocolade. Licht gebrande moutige smaak. Smaakvol stevig bier.
Mooie chocolade bruin bier met een goede kraag. Ruikt zoetig, chocolade, oud fruit. Smaakt zoetig, chocolade, herfstfruit.
Donker rood bruin bier met een goede beige schuim kraag. Ruikt kruidig, mout, caramel. Smaakt caramel, kruidig, speculaas, vrij droog.

Draught @ Taphouse. Pours clear red/amber with a tiny head. Aroma is dark dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar, raisins and plums. Flavour is sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied, avewrage carbonation. Finish is vinous.

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Clear dark brown beer, with some hints of red. Starts off with a huge head, which then dissipates to nothing. Nose is fruity, malty, some cherry, caramel, apple juice, toffee apple, fresh red apple. Taste is fruity, cherry, apple, orange peel, caramel, some slight sour, bitter earthy hop, slight citrousy acidic, slight red wine vinous, earthy hop, tangy hop. A lot going on in this.

Brown caramel with big fluffy head. Brown sugar, vinous, caramel. Both sweet and sour, bitter finish. Fizzy carbonation, full bodied. Drunk along with Rochefort 10, it is quite similar but aromas are a little softer.

Always an incredible pleasure to taste this beer!! Must be appreciated... without any limits... Just close your eyes and visualise what you are tasting... FIREWORKS!! of all colours, sizes and direction... A BIG WOW!!

Clear ruby/brown, cappuccino head
Caramel, chocolate, riped fruit,toffee, candy fruit, hint of licorice
Passito, biscuits, hazelnut, caramel, toffee, sweet licorice, milk chocolate, riped fruit
Light bittersweet ending

Bottle from Saveur Bière. Big, creamy, beige head. Dark brown, muddy body. Smells spicy, yeast, plum, apricot, apple. Tastes of plum, apricot, pepper, salt. A very spicy and complex brew. Both sweet and salt with a distinct bitter finish. Surprisingly good.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 smell dark malt some red fruit hint of caramel looks lot of foam can?t pour it at once it slowly pulls back very light brown foam and very dark ruby color... full bodied little red wine in the flavor dark malt and caramel this is a very pleasant beer

Bit similar to keun, but without that honey kick and less yeastiness. Fully malt orchestra with some floral hops, caramel, candy, light yeast, dried fruits. Mostly sweet with light bitterness and light tartness.
Very nice

Bouteille de33cl. Couleur cola, mousse très abondante, retombe assez vite. Des arômes fruités, caramel, frangipane, réglisse. Bel équilibre, texture qui "explose" en bouche. Trouvée à Vanuxeem - Ploegstaert.
Bruin bier met beige schuim en kleine gistdeeltjes. Niet slecht, maar ook niet heel bijzonder.
UPDATED: JUL 1, 2015 From zombier. In La Trappe glass. Another good brew from de dolle. However, I prefer their blonde ones

Il colore è marrone rossastro, quasi tonaca di frate, opalescente; molto generoso il "cappello" di schiuma, color ocra, fine, cremoso e molto persistente. Naso molto pronunciato e dolcissimo: toffee, zucchero di canna, frutta sotto spirito (uvetta, prugne), datteri, leggeri sentori di pane nero. Molto pulito. Il corpo è pieno, con una carbonazione abbastanza sostenuta. Il gusto non si discosta molto dallaroma: molto dolce, ma meno pulito, ripropone la stessa frutta sotto spirito, toffee, liquirizia. Ottimo laccenno di carattere vinoso. La bevuta continua nel (troppo) dolce, ed il palato rimane sempre abbastanza appiccicoso dopo ogni sorso. Cè un finale leggermente amaricante (frutta secca) ed etilico ma non basta a riportare il necessario equilibrio. Questa Oerbier si beve abbastanza bene, lalcool cè e riscalda ma non fa sentire troppo la sua presenza.
Dark Brown beer with a beige head. Hints of dark fruit, some wine aromas and yet also a bit sour. Top beer.

33cl bottle
 Pours a dark brown with a beige foaming head
 Aroma is caramel with fruit and bit of spice
 Taste is malty with sour flavours and a long bitter sour finish
 really nice beer like all of De Dolle,s beers
There are beers reference. A beer that evolves beautifully in the glass inside the mouth bottle. I do not know if the best is the smell, the taste in the mouth, the color, in short, a beer brutal!

Deep amber, clear. 
Full body, flavorful, intense heat. 
Sweetness is followed by mild bitterness. 
Fruity, alcoholic. 
Rich and powerful, good way to finish a tasting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Café Gaspar. Sweet fruity nose, perhaps so fruity that it seems a little bit solventy. That´s a greedy one, good body and caramel notes. Its simple but sincere. Liked it.

330ml bottle from Belgium in a Box - Pours a cloudy brown with huge beige head and very active carbonation. The nose is mellow and sweet, with caramel, various dark fruits, a slight winey note, and a touch of spicy alcohol. The flavour is full of dark fruits. Plum, raisin, a little bit of sour black cherry sweets, then a soft caramel sweetness. The finish is slightly dry and rather vinous, but quickly warms with the booziness kicking in. Mouthfeel is smooth and silky. Best Ive had in a while this.

Pours clear medium amber with two fingers plus of fluffy light tan head, good retention and lacing. (4/5) Nose is dark boozy fruit (dates and raisins), caramel malt, brown sugar, green apple, other stone fruits. (8/10) Taste is moderate sweet, mild tart, very light bitter. (8/10) Medium body, prickly carbonation, medium duration finish with a little lingering alcohol warming. (4/5)

Quite a nice BSDA, if a bit on the pricey side for where I got it. Very mild considering the beefy ABV, almost sherry-like and quite good for sipping. Almost feels like theres a little brett in there contributing to the mild tartness, but its quite restrained. Sweetness is similarly restrained, and kept well in check by the pleasantly prickly carbonation. Certainly much better than the amateurish label might have you expecting, and having read their writeup, Id like to cellar some for future experimentation. (16/20)
Tastes of raisins and caramel. Not overly sweet as the carbonation cuts right through it. Reddish brown colour.

Poured into stem glass from a bottle. Cloudy Mahogany colour with a generous off-white head. Nose is caramel, raisin, sour apple, dark malts, and brown sugar. Flavour is sour green apple, caramel, roasted malts, dark chocolate, dark dried fruit, molasses, and subtle spices. Awesome Belgian strong ale!
Never disappoints. Aroma of dark stone fruits, cherry, caramel malt... Flavor follows aroma. Sherry and pleasant alcohol notes. Super good sipping beer on a relaxing evening.

Aroma of toasted malt, caramel, rich dark fruits, berries, dried fruits, some candy sugar, yeast, spicy notes. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet a bit tart with a smooth light bittersweet finish. Hint of alcohol. Lovely sipper, Id love to try this aged for a few years.

Bottled; poured at home; direct pick-up from the brewery. Thanks Zombier for my brewery lift and to Anna and Joan for renting the car and driving me to the brewery!

Poured a lovely baige lacing over a chestnut-brown colour. Aroma is fascinating. A lot of depth here. Wild brett; farmhouse aromas; hey; fresh dough; garden dew and spruce. Some clove and coriander and fruity yeast esters.

Taste is ripe plums; burnt caramalisation; gorgeous wild berrys; tart plum; toffee; raisins and biscuit malt. Some wonderful use of brett and a little heavy on the tart. Its a fascinating beer and another example of the wonderful craft which De Dolle is.

Bottle. Pours deep amber with a huge off-white head. Aroma of malt, spices, some malt, grains and alcohol. Flavor is sweet and malt with some warming alcohol, grains, some caramel,yeast and spices. Medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Hazy reddish brown color with a medium sized foamy beige head. Aroma of apple, oak and berries. Sweet taste wit sourness and bitterness in a good balance.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

The taste and feel is sweet, soft and warm, with hints of caramel and red fruit. The smell is a whole other story though: it smells like sweet strawberry dairy drink, very fierse and sour. The smell doesnt match the taste in my opinion.

Aroma: Pear, spice, caramel, dark fruits
Appearance: mahagony colour, thin but stable foam
Taste: sweet, cherry, burnt raisins, earthy hops, sourness
Palate: full mouthfeel, dry finish, moderate carbonation
Overall: very nice take on BDSA, i think it is a beer what would go well with food like stake or game
Een heerlijk bier, met de smaak van karamel en hop. Mag zich meten met Rochefort 10. Zeer vol en uitgebalanceerd.

Pours a cloudy dark amber brew with a huge reddish head with good retention. Aroma of brown sugar, roasted nuts, candy sugars, figs and grapes, with notes of spices and yeast. Taste is overripe grapes and yeast together with stonefruit with a slight sourness in the finish

Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg, delt med Ovesen mens esb-vørteren kjølner: gusher raskt brakt under kontroll. Høyt storboblet beige skum som legger seg til en film. ABV is 9%. Opp gjennom skummet stiger en Intens og fruktig, bærlignende aroma. I den vinøse smaken finner jeg også litt krydder. En kraftig maltkropp holder det hele elegant i sjakk. Storartet øl, og de 9 på Richters skala merkes først i magen.

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 03.04.15. A gusher. Nutty brown. Huge and foamy pale brown head. Aroma of ripe berries, dried berries and fruit and some malt. Similarly fine and fruity taste. Complex, while easily drinkable. Very carbonated.
Donker Amber kleurig bier met een witte schuimkraag. Smaak het zoete van aardbei en rozebottel en een minimale bitter afdronk. Gehad als kado voor Thijmen.

Bottle. Fresh strawberries in the nose. Hazy garnet under an eternal, rocky, tan cover. Extremely fruity estery flavour that is slightly medicinal. Accents of strawberry, white grape, and stone fruit ending with a moderate to medium, dry, Belgian bitterness. Medium body, smooth and warming. Unique.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought from a colleague.
Hazy dark brown with a big off-white head. Malty aroma with lots of dark fruits and some caramel and Belgian yeast. Taste is bittersweet. Body is massive but due to the very lively carbonation it is experienced lighter than all those heavy abts. Warming alcohol in the finish. Great Belgian beer.
Medium mokka head, black coloured body with some brown glow, sweet candy caramel, medium to high carbonation medium bitter waming herbs some candy taste very different bit complex taste combination

Dark brown color with light beige head. Aroma of sweet malt with some tobacco. Taste of licorice, Brown rock candy Sugar and dark fruit.
	

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
poured from a bottle. This beer has a firm tartness to it. Some caramel notes as well as a fruitiness and slight earthy character. Not bad.

Bottle. Some low gushing at opening, pours in hazy dark body with high froasty off-white head. Aroma has caramel, nutty, roasty, yeasty. Taste has an alcohol character upfront, dark forest fruits, dried raisins, very light roasty. Bitterness is earthy and pretty low and hidden, overwhelmed with alcohol. Body is full, high carbonation.

33cl in teku. Pours a super abundant and super creamy off-white head, orange beige like; dark orange to mahogany brown colour, dirty and hazy. Smells quite incredible: toffee, lovely yeast notes, dried fruits, caramel, butter-ish, brown/cane sugar, gorgeously wrapping and intense. Tastes caramel malty, candied fruit, earthy, hints of licorice and chocolate, seems like a creme caramèl in a glass; sweetness is medium to high but never invasive, also cause is such balanced by a subtle but almost medium level bitterness; light tarness hints. Medium to full body, average carbonation which is right enough, creamy texture. Another awesome de Dolle, a mix between a dark and blonde belgian strong ale, gets the best notes from both worlds. Lovely ; )

1987 (Rodenbach yeast) vs 2014 at Kulminator in Antwerp-Belgium, bottles. The 1987 is stunning and amazingly in shape after 28 years. Pours dark amber with bright reddish appearance, nice and still performing off white foam. Nose: the warmest malty nose ever, light dry fruit, lovely feel of wood, cherries. Cherries are there, lovely feel. Mouth: God! I love this (mortlach come here right now!). Cherry juice, apple, warm feel embracing your chest! I am in shock! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled: unk (it was cut off most of the bottle), my guess would be early 2014. 

Pours dark brown with a huge tan top that falls to a persistent quilt. Smells rich with prunes, candi, sweet toasted malts, some yeast. Flavor is malty, some mild musty oxidation, some stone fruits, a touch of almost brett like earthiness, some almost ruby porto character. Lots of depth in this beer, very surprised. medium on full bodied with high carb and a dry finish. Almost tannic in the finish. Im very interested by this beer, might pick a few up to age and see what happens. It is tarts up a bit over two years I would be very, very excited.

My second try with this beer. Ticked it a 2 back then and Im sticking to it. 

Sweet tobacco, raisin, and caramel smell. Bready taste with a light body. Minimal carbonation. Dry finish.

Tastes like it could be a Belgian Double but doesnt have the body. kind of week on the tongue. Would recommend a St. Benardus Abt 12 over this any day.

Schenkt een donkeramberkleurig bier met witte schuimkraag. Ruikt naar mout, gist, gedroogd fruit, kruiden. Smaak is bitterzoet, moutig, gedroogd fruit, hoppig. Een bier die ik wel kan waarderen, maar dat niet iedereen zal bevallen door de zoete en wat kruidige smaak. De nasmaak is bitter en grassig.
brown, hazy, tan foam, roasty, toast, nuts, full body, oily feel, average carbonation, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

Dark brown-reddish color with big beige head. Dark fruits, spices, candied sugar. A bit of tartness still, heavy body and an extremely rich taste. Medium carbonation. This is a serious win. Can compete with the good Abts/Quadrupels. More intensely fruity than these.

Pours a hazy brown body with a giant head. Sweet and malty aroma. Nice and malty taste with sweet tones.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared tonight at the meeting. 
Fairly clear deep reddish gold color. Fruity spicy light earth. Nice brew, thanks Mike.

33cl bottle at home. Clear amber with a small white soapy head. Medium to full body with low to moderate carbonation. Quite sweet with some bitter tones. Caramel, malts, brown sugar, ripe fruits, spices and warming alcohol. A tasty strong ale.

In bottiglia da 33cl. Colore bruno, schiuma fine, molto abbondante e persistente. Aroma di frutta secca, uvetta, nocciola. Al palato una nota calda ed etilica evidente con sentori di frutta secca, uvetta, leggero caramello. Finale che bilancia la dolcezza generale della birra.

Bottle @ home from De Dolle brewery, Esen - BE. Color: dark brown beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: caramel and candy notes with well malt taste. Roasted malt. Taste: nice caramel and high malt domination. Great complexity, with small woody notes, and alcohol finish. Aftertaste: caramel and alcohol. Really nice but please meditate it, and take your time to enjoy it !

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2015 De Dolle Oerbier uitgeschonken in Oerbierglas. Bij het openen van het flesje komt er al wat schuim uit. Een mooie volle beige schuimkraag dus in het glas, kleur van het bier is donker roodbruin licht wazig. De geur is kruidig met Belgische gist. De smaak is stevig eerst zoetig en dan licht zurig, beetje wijnachtig, lekkere vrij complexe smaak. Smaaktonen van kandijsuiker, hout en licht zurige en zacht bittere hopsmaak. Het vrij hoge koolzuur gehalte is wel duidelijk aanwezig, De afdronk is medium lang, hoppig  en licht droog met een warme alcoholische afsluiter. Een goed voorbeeld weer van een uitstekend Belgisch bier dit Oerbier, zeker eentje die ik vaker zal drinken. Niet zo complex en speciaal als Stille Nacht, maar absoluut weer een mooi kwaliteitsproduct van de Dolle Brouwers.
Damn this is one fine dark Belgian ale. Im incredibly impressed by its creaminess, rich aroma and wonderful taste. Its Palate is wonderful and leaves a very nice bitterness behind. Love it!
Not bad, but too much bread and yeast bulge. More precisely overlap everything else

Appearance is a murky light brown, with excellent lacing and a frothy head. Aroma is sweet candy sugars with some roasted malt. Taste is similar- quite sweet with malty tones. Palate is very good like all De Dolle beers- although not as creamy or smooth as Mad Bitch or Stille Nacht. A bit dry on the aftertaste. Overall its definetly a vert good ale as Ive come to expect from this brewery, but its not their best one.

For sure the best of the De Dolle triumvirate tasting from today. I think my rating may be skewed a bit high from perception - the reserve version of this is on the RateBeer Top 50 Belgium. But anyway - its fantastic. High-ABV but drinkable. Probably sits somewhere between 8-10 on my scale but Ill give it the benefit of the doubt with a 9 until next tasting.

di colore marrone rossastro, con schiuma bella cremosa e un aroma dolce. Ha una carbonizzazione bella sostenuta con sapori di prugna e zucchero di canna con un finale leggero di liquirizia. Buona bevuta ma forse troppo dolce che stanca verso il finale.

330 ml bottle during Brussels vacation. Reddish amber with beige head. Aroma of malt, sour candy, light fruit, grapes and some soapy detergent notes. Taste is medium sweet, grapes, malty, sugars with a finish with grape peels and sugar.

Bottle, 33cl / Botella, 33cl. 
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine. 
A: Brown / Marron
T/S: Malt, sweet, fruity, yeast, alcohol / Malta, dulce, afrutado, levadura, alcohol

The very first Dolle beer, since 1980, and in that respect one of the first modern craft beers in Belgium. Had a crate in the cellar last year but forgot to properly rate it - hence this rating based on old notes. Hazy bronze coloured under a very thick and moussy, lacing, pale beige head. Very estery and yeasty, elegant and inviting aroma; overripe grapes and peaches, raisins, brown bread, port wine, caramel, floral hops. Sweet onset, not cloying candi sugar sweetness, very estery and fruity, Belgian yeastiness, soft mouthfeel with spritzy carbonation, nice caramelly malt sweetness, evolving into a lightly spicy, yeasty, florally hop bitterish finish with agreeable warming, port-like alcohol and a hint of roasted bitterishness - which, I hasten to add, wasnt there when I first tasted this, the recipe clearly has been altered a bit some years ago to approach a more Scotch-style ale, but then this seems to have been its original form so I guess it has been kind of returned to its own roots. I liked the previous version better, especially fresh from tap at the brewery, but this still is a great, tasty classic.

09/01/2015 @home 33cl bottle from Bierhalle Deconinck.
Brown colour with nice beige head. Aroma : dark malts, caramel, dark fruits, Taste : dark malts, candy sugar, dark fruits. At the end warming alcohol.

Bottle from trade with ElManana, many thanks! Leicht trübes dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit einer geringen aber stabilen beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach reifem Obst, Karamell, viel Malz. Geschmack nach reifen Früchten, leicht würzig, leicht alkoholisch, auch zum Ende hin viele reife Früchte.

From the start, when I opened the bottle, I had to be realy quick, cause of the foam and yeast coming out of the bottle on a fast tempo. The aroma is realy sweet, the brown sugar comes out, together with some burned caramel. The taste is sweet at the beginning, but results in a fine bitterness at the end, you can taste some caramel. its a fine, well-balanced beer.
33cl @ bottle. Belga di colore marrone, profumata e dolce. Ottima al naso, meno in bocca, nel complesso più che buona.
Its caramel, spices, light malts beer with a mild bitter finish, that doesnt linger long.
Abundant foam. Nice reddish appearance. Potent beverage. Tastes like champagne. Malty in the mouth. Alcohol aftertaste.
Belle mousse. On ne sent pas les 9%. Agréable à boire. Bière fraîche, elle rapelle le champagne

On tap at Sergio's World Beer. The pour is a nice ruby-ish amber color with a thin ring of tannish head and no lace. The aroma is great. Apple, pear, light sweet cherry, and a bit of lemony or orangey citrus. The flavor is more belgian. The fruits are there, and there is the distinct yeastiness. The flsvors are mellow, but pretty good. The mouth feel is a bit light, and I wish there was a little more carbonation. The aftertaste is lingeringly fruity and just delicious. Not bad at all!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at Groote Witte Arend, Antwerp. Had this beer loads of times but first time actually rating it. Pours a murky dark brown with a massive small bubbly tan head. Aroma of malts, light citrus, overripe dark fruit and light aniseed. The palate is where it really stands out with a Champaign like feel, small light bubbles dancing around on your tongue and brining out the flavors. Over moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Light full bodied with that lovely champagne like carbonation.

Brown beer, beige head. Nose is malty, some caramel, yeast and spice notes´, milk chocolate. Flavor is sweet, sugary, dried fruit, raisins, chocolate, roasty-toasty notes and alcohol. Very nice balance, great stuff. Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks!
Splendida bevuta. Birra da meditazione ma al contempo molto beverina, quando si hanno 9 gradi e non ci si stanca mai di bere è un gran bel segnale secondo me! Grandissima birra!

Flasche (33 cl; MHD: 4/2015) von Getränkefeinkost Berlin. - Rotbraun, trüb; enorm reichlicher Schaum. - Nase scharf fruchtig-hopfenherb, leicht säuerlich, weinig. - Antrunk etwas scharf säuerlich, etwas Gras, weiße Trauben, zugleich warm dunkelmalzig mit leichten Röstnoten. Würzige Kräuter, Lebkuchen. Gut rezent, schaumig; etwas dünnes Mundgefühl. Im Abgang fruchtig herb und gut malzbitter. - Eigenartige Mischung von dunkelmalzigen Aromen und säuerlich-scharfen Zügen. Wirkt irgendwie unfertig, wie halb umgekippt. Schwer vorzustellen, daß das so gedacht war.
330ml bottle from favourite beer and 10th December on the Advent Calander. Deep dark Amber colour with an off white head. Aroma has caramel and stewed dark fruits. Plum, fruit and caramel flavour.

I think it had originally pours a clean amber, but once I got to the bottom of the bottle, it looked a murky red-brown with visible clots of yeast sediment floating around. Yum! 1.5 inches of dust head froth that fades at a moderate rate. Snap, crackle, pop! Aroma is bread crust and tart cherry, pear and apple, bit of raisin and spice. Hint of soap in there as it warms. Body is light, watery up front with a slightly oily finish and a prickly wave of carbonation. Flavor is bread, bread crust, some apple, spice, and even a bit of yeasty moldy cheese. Spicy finish. Im wondering if I should have been more careful with that sediment, yet it still very good. Interesting BSA. Im not exactly sure what to compare it too; maybe other De Dolle beers.   At first I felt it was a bit watery and had an aftertaste that was more bitter than yummy, but as it warms its complexity (of spice, raisin, midway through taste) is coming through, retaining a high score.

- Alcoholpercentage van 9%
- Smakelijk biertje destijds gedronken
- Complimenten aan de brouwerij- en brouwmeester
- Nog geen topper, maar wel de hoge waardering die verdiend

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Clear deep red color, tanned head. Aroma is spices, sweet licorice notes, wood. Taste is quite high co2 which makes taste lighter. Licorice, plums, spices.

0,33L bottle. Pours dark brown with light brown head. The small head stays. Aroma is caramel, dark fruits, plums, malt. Flavor is sweet, dark fruits, plums, malt. caramel. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: very nice.

33 cl fles, bottled jun 2014. Mooi donker, bijna zwart met stevig schuim dat lang blijft. Aromas een beetje zurig, alcohol en wijnkelder. Redelijk wat koolzuur. Mooie ronde smaak met tonen van pruim, kersen, amandel. Afdronk is lang en zwaar met een aangename bitter op de tong. Een echt verwarmend bier, heerlijk!

Bottle from 1987. (26 years old at the time), 330 ml at Kulminator, Antwerp. Pours unclear reddish brown with small off-white head. Sweet with sour touch. Dark fruit, plums, nuts, yeast. Complex. Quite a lot of yeast sediment at the bottom. Very interesting experience.

33 cl, flaske, 7,5 % ABV iflg. etikketten, købt i Belgisk Bryg i Emdrup, 18. november 2014.
Kastanje-brun ufiltreret stærk belgier med kæmpe offwhite skumkrone på 7-8 cm. Tætskummet og svinder ganske flot til snelandskab og senere til et par millimeter kant og overflade. 
Dejlig aroma af diverse malte og belgisk gær. Lidt fjern syrlighed fra noget ubestemmelig frugt. Alkohol.
Fantastisk dejlig smag. Let syrlig, men ellers sød og bitter i meget fuldendt balance. Kompleks øl. Det syrlige ligger gemt i det bitre gennem hele smagsbilledet og giver øllet et særligt indtryk. Opsummering: Mellem til kraftig bitter, mellem sødme og let syrlig.
Brygget har et forholdsvis højt indhold af kuldioxid, måske en anelse for højt, selvom det bliver mere roligt gennem lang nydelse. Konsistensen er sticky og eftersmagen er lang og bitter/sød. Fyldig krop.
Bedste Belgian Strong Ale jeg har smagt i lang tid.

Bottle from a trade with Mathieuc. Pours a dark non see-through brown with copper hues. Head is a fluff off white, clingy lace. Nose is sweet , sugary, a touch of some dark fruits, more caramel. Tastes sweet, fruity, spicy, some bitterness and Abv burn. Me likey.

Appearance is light brown, murky, a two-finger off-white foamy head which slowly settles. Aroma- sugary sweetness, sweet breads, malty and yeasty, banana cake, some hoppiness, caramel, banoffee pie. Taste- sweet fruits, foamy mouthfeel, brown sugar, cherries, fruitcake, bitter hops come through to the finish. Very nice.

Clear reddish brown colour with really big and thick head on top. Head became so big that it started pouring out of the glass by itself. Aroma has red berries, plums, dried fruits and nuts. Taste has plums, dried fruits, nuts and berries. Slight alcohol taste in the end and tannin. Maybe some metallic notes too. Medium body with high carbonation.

Bottle from an IP trade at Hoppy Loft. Thanks, Mathieu! Pours dark brown with a light beige head. Aroma is molasses, dates, a hint of cherry. Taste is molasses, honey, dates, dark bread. Dark bread crust bitterness in the finish.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2015 First rating 20th October 2014.
Bottle 0.33l from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark brown color with small white head.Taste amd aroma of roasted malt, coffee, spices.Carbonated and good complexed.3.6

Second rating 04 March 2015
Vertical tasting at Kulminator Antwerpen Belgium with my bro ippopotamo36.Ajdeeee Alberto.Thank you budalo.Hi Dirk & Leen.

1st bottle from 1987
Bottle 0.33l pour it dark brown color with medium white head . Unbelievable carbonation after so many years.On the nose sour, chocolate.Taste and aroma cherry, sweer fruits, spices and great Rodenbach yeast inside this bottle, which kick this great flavour to the top.All together little bit flat.Totally different from the new one.3.9

2nd bottle from 2014
Bottle 0.33l pour it dark brown color with medium white head.On the nose little bit metallic.Taste and aroma of malt, spices, again metallic I dont know why and on the end roasted coffee.Great experience to try this two great bottles.3.6

330 ml bottle purchased at Julios Liquors in March 2014. Aroma is burnt caramel, brown sugar and dark fruits. 
Flavor is a nice complex array of burnt sugars, toffee, pumpernickel bread, spice and Belgian yeast with some earthiness. Trances of anise. Carbonation is low and creamy. Body is more then medium. Nice night cap or after dinner brew.

Clear deep amber with a sultry aroma of boozy honey and toasted blonde grains. Big rich flavor of honey and toasted English muffin and a winter seasonal toffee earthy maltiness. Rich and boozy and malty. Warming and confronting and balanced but semisweet.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in the Duvels tulip.
A: Pours very dark amber to brown color forming a huge fizzy and bubbled beige head. Completely cloudy. Good retention and some chunks of lacings left in the glass. A thin layer that remains forever on the top
S: Strong notes dark fruits in the nose. Mainly raisins. Reminds a port wine a bit. Also strong notes of wood, candy sugar, caramel malts, roasted malts and bready yeasts
T: Sweet caramel upfront. Strong notes of raisins, candy sugar, caramel malts, Belgian bready yeasts. Strong Belgian character. Strong and warming. Some alcohol can be felt is the very end. Complex beer. Good bitter-sweet balance. In overall, a sweet beer with a mild bitter end
M: Heavy and creamy body. Molasses. Medium to low carbonation. Fruity bittersweet aftertaste
O: Great drinkability despite the 9.5%. Excellent beer. Just another de Dolle masterpiece
[ BA Review @ 1/28/2010 ]

Julie thinks it is okay. It is suppose to be a strong belgium but it is a little sour. She does not mind it. She burps. She wonders if it is off. She gives a 2.8

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle from Bar Volo. Toronto, ON. 9.0% alc. / vol. Aroma of cherries. Cherries, prunes, booze.
Mild carbonation. Taste matches the aroma

Pours a cloudy dark amber brew with a huge reddish head with good retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low sour with dark fruits and spices, medium to robust bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate sigue with a sour finish and a medium aftertaste, ver y good

"9% but the same label. dark fruit and yeastiness abound. the aroma is definitely more lactic than the flavor, but there is a slight presence in the flavor as well. not as spicy as some belgians, which is nice for a change of pace. this one was good, not great (like the special reserve)."

A bit active when I popped the cap, the pour was very slow but still very foamy. Deep brownish red in colour.

It smells very yeasty and dark fruity. A semi aweetness here that crosses over to a light tartness.

Plums, raisins, black cherry tartness, yeasty. My, this is complex but theres a symphony going on.

Medium bodied and co2d, some heat from the alcohol but not to an extreme.

It finishes decidedly on the dry side. Very very good.

On tap at the Thirsty Monk (AVL).
Deep red-amber body with a small head.
Interesting and appealing aroma; hints of brandy, wine and vague ripe fruits. Mild and subtle alcohol esters for 12% ABV. 
Flavor. Fruity; slightly tartness with a touch of sweetness and bitterness. Moderately strong and mildly funky flavor seems to reflect red wine barrel aging.

Bottle from CBX. Chestnut pour with a frothy white head. Aroma of brown sugar, roasted nuts, candy sugars, figs and grapes, with notes of spices and yeast. Effervescent body with the sweeter notes hit the front with roasted nuts, toasted bread, candy sugars, dark fruits mid palate and finishing off with touches of spice. Mmmmm.

@Mechelen, Schenkt bruin met licht kaki kraag. Aroma is zoetig, mout, caramel, donker fruiten zoals rozijnen.
smaken zijn gelijk een volle prikkelende co2 in de mond, caramel, rozijn, alcohol. goede donkere fruiten en kandijsuiker, redelijke body, redelijk zoet en redelijk fuitig, mis een beetje de zure toetsen om het tot een echte kraker te maken, jammer had met een beetje verheugd op dit biertje..wellicht was die gewoon wat te hoog.

Bottle. Reddish brown with creamy beige head. Fruity bready aroma and a hint of spice. Initial taste quite sweet becoming slightly acidic and sour with a refreshing bitter finish. Full carbonation and mouthfeel. Decent.

23 year old 1991 vintage bottle at Akkurat Stockholm, april 19th 2014. Deep red body, unclear, with a small beige head. Aroma of berries, branch, moss, yeast. Taste is lightly sour with plums, roast, wood, nuts. Deep complexity, sweet raisin and yeast aftertaste. Really nice.

Bottle. Mahogany-brown with a large and lasting tan head. The aroma is of yeast, caramel malt, fruity (plums, something sweet like dates or prunes). It has too much carbonation for our liking. The flavour has smooth malts, chocolate, fruits, distinct yeast with a lightly acidic finish, some bitterness.

Noir ponctuée par une dense et persistante tête teintée. Arôme fort de pain d'épices. Saveurs épicées, pain grillé et régulier. Bonne et puissante
---
Black punctuated by dense and persistent head tinted. Strong aroma of gingerbread. Spicy, toasted and regular bread. Good and powerful

Bottle. Dark ruby/mahogany with a thick eggshell colored head. Aroma is bread crusts and construction paper. Taste has lots of caramel and apple but is badly oxidized. Bottle is about a year old and didn't hold up well. Substantial booze. Rich mouthfeel and strong carb. Will look for a fresher bottle because this one unfortunately didn't work out.
Bottle 9%. Dark red to brown. Head large and beige. Aromas of hops and faint smoke. Taste medium sweet and sour. Fair carbonation. Finish a little flat and sweet.

Bought this bottle at de Bierschuur in Poppel. The beer has a dark brown color and a nice cream colored head with a lot of bubbles. The aroma is very fruity and also has tones of yeast, bread and, licorice and candy. The taste is fruity and start to evoluate into a nice freshness and little sourness in which the tones from the aroma come clearly forward. This makes this beer well balanced. The finish is light sour and a has a medium bitterness, noticable for a while. 
Bravo to this beer, one of the better strong ales Ive tasted so far.
Nose is raisins, dried plums, fruit cake, booze. Flavor is same plus dense bready/biscuity, spice, bread pudding.
Een lekker biertje met een goede, volle smaak aan. Een bier zoals het hoort te zijn.

33cl bottle. Hazy dark brown reddish colour with a large foamy tan head. Caramel, raisins, yeast and slight sourness. Average carbonation and medium to full body. Taste is well balanced slightly more sweet than bitter with some sour notes. Overall, a very good beer that I would to try again in a more cold weather.

Bouteille. L'île du malt. Robe marron profond coiffée d'une épaisse mousse beige évanescente. Nez sur le malt, le grain de café et la levure belge. Fruitée sur la cerise noire et la prune. Bouche complexe, piquante sur la levure , légèrement acidulé contrebalancée par une belle amertume. Notes de sucre brun , de malt torréfié , de figue et de pruneaux avec un arrière goût de cerise. Corps suave avec une belle effervescence. Un bonheur de bière. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours extremely dark brown with a copious, tan head. Nose is dried fruits, molasses, dark toffee, light booze notes, maybe a hint of tobacco. Taste is very well-balanced, a little to the sweet side, but not too sweet. Full body, moderate carbonation. Delicious brew!

Sample from a 2009 bottle at En Öl- & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg, april 2014. Pours deep dark red, nearly brown with a two finger slowly dissipating beige head. Aroma is malty, with dried fruit, figs, candi sugar, yeast tones and a slight sour touch. Taste is complex with lots of sweet and woody malt and dried fruit, some spices, yeast, red berries, slight bitter hops. Ends dry with a slight woody tartness. Body is medium to full, carbo surprisingly high with sharp bubbles (but that goes well with the slight tart ending), creamy texture. A perfect example why Belgien knows their shit. So complex and drinkable at the same time.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Aroma: Malty, fruity, yeast. Taste: Fruity, yeast. Medium body.
Great beer that is reminiscent of a lighter quad. Raisins, pumpernickel bread, yeast, spice, candidate sugar. Taste is sweet I with a dry finish. Overall good.

Igazán elismerésre méltó jellemvonásokra lehetünk figyelmesek már rögtön az elején, habja ugyanis maga az örökkévalóság, az illatáradat pedig, mely fogad minket, elképesztően gazdag és fenséges. Az élesztős, pirított magvas alapokon nyugvó aromák marcipános, datolyás, kandiscukros színezetű kavalkádot képeznek az édeskés és savanykás benyomások alkotta skálán egyensúlyozva, leginkább azonban az édesség irányába tolódva. A szánkban tartva elsőként szilvához hasonló vonások rajzolódnak ki, majd félérett alma savassága lép a színre, végül pedig - az illatát tekintve kissé talán meglepő módon - borhoz foghatóan száraz, kissé fanyar és csak enyhén szénsavas ízvilágban lehet részünk, mely minden részletében maga az elegancia. Izgalmas és stílusos, a figyelmet teljes mértékben magára vonó főzet.

Only like this one on draught! Draight at Fermentoren (amazing, as this is only possible to find on draught at the brewery in Esen!). Reminded me of years ago, where we called this kind of beer in Flemmish an ice-cream : soft, creamy, beautiful lacing, viscose, full bodied. On draught its not overly sweet like on bottle. Great draught beer! Next to their Stille Nacht Xmas beer, my Dolle Brouwers favorite.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen 14/7-14. Sweet malty and fruity with yeasty and spicy notes, dried fruit, candi sugar and nuts.

In tap at kickbacks. A pungent, alcohol flavor comes through before a sweet brandy flavor with hints of a Flemish red. Not a big fan.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is dark red to brown. Head is medium to large and beige. Medium carbonation. Medium to high sweetness, medium sourness. Aroma is wood, grapes, caramel.

Dark bread and moderate dark fruit, with a background of mustiness and alcohol. Clear brown with garnet highlights and no head. Taste is a little vinous with a lingering sweetness. Slight floral hops and a moderate low tartness in the back half of the palate.

En copa muestra un color mezcla ámbar- marrón con media cabeza de espuma de poca retención; en nariz buenos aromas a vino tinto, frambuesa y pasas. En boca entrada potente y licorosa con amargor sutil y pos gusto dulce y seco; notas a especias y caramelo; buen cuerpo con carbónico alto, el alcohol se siente demasiado sobresaliendo en exceso junto a las especias y demasiado carbónico, monótona resumiendo esperaba mucho más de esta cerveza.
Hard to describe this one. Hazy dark amber brown with foam top. Roasted malt, dried red fruits, gastric acid. Finish is long with more alcohol and wood. Complex

11.9 oz bottle pours a cloudy amber with a off white head. Aroma of malts, fruit and alcohol. Taste is plums, raisins and malts.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
