Deep brown colored beer with a creamy froth. Aroma of spices, raisons and lots of sweetness. The taste is sweet due to lots of raisons and sugar. Alcohol comes too much through at the finish.
Bottle 0.33l at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Bottled FEB 2014. Colour is dark brown with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark fruits, sweetness, spices and malts. Too carbonated.

Bottle at en Öl och Whiskeymässa 2014, 2014-04-11 Göteborg vintage 2009
AR: rasins, plums, red wine
AP: hazy mahoghony, no head
F: fizzy, sour grape, fizzy

Pours a large frothy light brown head that mostly diminishes. Bodybisnhazy dark brown, sparkles are visible.
Aroma contains modrate malts (light bread, cookie, hay, roasted malts, molasses and mild coffee), light yeasts (flowers, grass, orange), light yeasts (dough, barnyard) and grape, raisin, apple, peach, cherry, cassis, toffee, brown sugar, apricot and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then light acidic and light sweet, followed by sweet, light bitter and sweet and finally light bitter. Inbetween tartness (like a sour ale) is noticeable. 
Body is medium, with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Contains a mix of sour and sweet fruits, with a mocca coffee finish. Complex and subtle, very good.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 Smell of raisins, quite a bit booze, and sweet sticky plums. Taste is quite heavy, but has a very mellowed out tartness, and the yeast in this one is quite different. Heavy raisin notes, some vanilla, weak plum, very boozy, and very sweet. Reminds me of Rochefort 8, but signifantly less refreshing, and way sweeter.

Aroma: caramel, malts. Appearance: dark brown, medium beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters expand, turn slightly sour. Overall: great Belgian Strong Ale, nice aroma. Bottle at Cambrinus, Bruges.

Bottle @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Hazy dark amber, medium off white head that settles nicely, some lacing. Aroma, malty, Belgian yeast, dark fruits, red wine notes, alcohol, spices. Taste, malty, Belgian yeast, spices, red berries, raisin, dark fruits, alcohol, chocolate notes, spices. Red wine like mouth feel. Low to medium carbonation. 
Please let let the beer rest and warn before drinking.

Bottle @Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours hazy dark amber. Of white small head. Aroma is dark dried fruits. Belgian yeast. Some alcohol and res wine notes. Spicy. Taste is a bit tart and medium bitter. Warming alcoholic finish.


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A really surprising beer. Caramel, dark chocolate ant the start with a more bitter end with coffee and alcohol swarming over the tip of tongue. 
Lekkere drankje

UPDATED: MAR 9, 2015 Bottle. Dark dark brown. Aromas are sweet, Bock style: raisins, plums, hint of cherry, bubblegum, earth, gentle booziness. Taste is a little overwhelming and powerful at first: very, very robust. Dark dark chocolate, some hot tar sensation almost, sweet evolution accomodated with swelling of alcohol, nutmeg, overripe cherries in the aftertaste. 
Aangenaam donkere, licht zoet van karamel met een neiging naar chocola, met een karakteristieke Dolle Brouwers toets van specerijen &#40;peperkoekkruiden&#41; in het midden van de slok &#40;deze komt ook terug bij de Dolle Brouwers Boskeun, maar is daar meer nadrukkelijk&#41;. Dit maakt hem voor mij prettiger te drinken dan de wat zoetere bruin bier varianten.
Again a original brew from de Dolle brouwers. Sweet, fruity and yeasty, but also hoppy and even a bit tardiness.

A- Pours a deep, ruddy brown hue with a huge, 3 finger off white head that leaves lots of lacing on the way down.

S- Sweet apple, plum, grape

T- Raisin, fig, sweet plum, lots of residual sweetness on the back end.

M- Medium bodied with lots of carbonation.

D- Seemed too sweet and too effervescent for me. Maybe some time on this one helps it come together.

Dark hazy appearance.
Aroma of a stuff boozy drink. One note palate, maybe two. Not vey complex. A bit of chocolate and then fruit alcohol burn. Failed attempt to mimic abt12.

Poured into tulip a brown color with decent off white head. One of the most interesting beers I have had, very complex. Aroma for me was roasted malts, some nut, wood, wine, all together it had an aroma similar to a good brewed soy sauce. Taste was similar to the aroma. the beer was yeasty and had a port or sherry flavor. Alcohol for me came late in the finish and was warming to some extant. The alcohol seemed well blended till that point. I get some soy sauce also in the finish. Med bodied and quite wet, a little too easy to drink, like that is a problem. Incredible.
Draft at dolle. Pours dark amber with honey glaze hue. Aroma of carrot, malts abd salted caramel. Light body, slight sour. Taste of raisins and nuts. Nice red vrown sour but a tad out of balance.
Cerveza rojiza oscura, en cierta medida tiene un toque amargo pero queda dissimulado con el dulzor
Keg @ De Dolle Brewery bar, Esen. Pours a mahogany brown with roasted, dark malts, brown sugar, alcohol, nuts and a nice cloaking sweetness. Very interesting beer worth further inspection.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled in 6/2013. Pours very hazy deep ruby red color with a fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with a large amount of streaming carbonation retaining the head. Aromas of pear, apple, raisin, plum, fig, white grape, caramel, candi sugar, bread, clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness. Very nice aromas with good complexity of fruity/earthy yeast ester and balanced dark/candi sugar malt sweetness; with good strength. Taste of big raisin, plum, fig, pear, apple, white grape, caramel, bread, candi sugar, clove, herbal, light pepper, and yeast earthiness. Lingering notes of raisin, plum, pear, apple, fig, white grape, caramel, bread, candi sugar, clove, herbal, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity of fruity/earthy yeast with a good amount of dark/bready malt sweetness; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and moderately slick mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent Belgian strong dark ale. All around great complexity and balance of fruity/spicy yeast and dark/bready malt sweetness; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Black color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, nuts, hops chocolate and roasted malts. Bitter finish with nuts, chocolate, roasted malts. Very nice brew.
Bottle from Beer Mania. Raisins, brown sugar, toffee, licorice, cola, ceder-wood, figs and cassis. High sweetness.

Bottle from my friend, many thanks Dano.  Very dark brown color with minimal beige head. Sweet syrupy, malty aroma. Taste, dark malt, strawberry syrup, caramel, vinous notes, light hoppy bitterness, sherry, wood. Very tasty sipping nightcap.

Deep mahogany with big off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. Smell has a lot of blackberries. Lots of red fruits and berries, then roasted malts, brown sugar, dark chocolate. Lots of fruity complexity. Big sweetness, with sour in the beginning and end. Finish has mild bitterness. Medium bodied, full carbonation. Very good!

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2014 It is gorgeous both in color, aroma. The slightly sour taste in a mouth is subjected to strong impression. It is also likely to keep a good balance of whole if there is a little more sweetness here that feeling of alcohol is surging at the same time, but the sweetness is not enough. It must be the best beer if they have it.

33cl Geers 2012-2013. BB?. Pours an opaque dark chestnut. Upfront liquorice and candi sugar in the nose. Dry and sweet-spicy components of: roasted nuts, vinsanto, sherry +cask dryness, caramel, rum, Lebkuchen, mulled wine. Heavy carb, comparatively light-bodied. Nice and dry, still a heady sipper.
Pours cloudy dark brown with nice lasting fluffy white head. Aroma is charcoal, cocoa, malt, slightly roasty. Flavor is malt, cocoa, hint of nuts and alcohol.
Delicious! Lots of malt, dates and plums in the aroma and taste. A bit of tartness kicks in on the palate. It has a beautiful tamarind color.
herbs, grass, floral, nuts, cereal, cloudy, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, oily feel, medium body, average carbonation,
Bière ambrée, assez fruitée et sucrée, légère amertume, pas mal de corps, alcool présent. Plus complèxe quil ny parait.
Wow! Draft. Dark color, with ruby highlights. Tons of malt aroma and flavor. Very smooth. Alcohol totally not evident. Awesome!

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 schiuma pomposa e persistente color nocciola a grana grossa aroma moderatamente malati con note balsamiche da luppolo e trionfo del lievito con note di ciliegina vino stalla e spezie.sapore inizialmente dolce con toni acidi il finale è lungo e dolce con punte di amaro vino. ottima

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 33cl in a Delirium Tremens glass. Pours a medium reddish/dark amber colour with a truly huge white head that lasts all through the drink. Taste is overripe grapes and yeast with a slight sourness in the finish. Mouthfeel is very good both firm and refreshing at the same time with excellent carbonation. Aftertaste is somewhat reminiscent of St. Bernardus ABT expertly blended with red wine. Excellent.

(33 cl bottle with red cap that simply says "bottled" but I know for a fact Ive been storing this in my basement for a few years) Bottle opens with quite an emission of carbonation. Sounds like the yeast has been active. Pours a clear, light mahogany with tan head that seems very active in the glass constantly overturning bubbles and regenerating nicely. Aroma has notes of vinegar, sour cherries, yeast, straw and a hint of bready malt. Oily texture, lively carbonation and a tart finish with a hint of caramel. Flavour is sour and slightly sweet. A strange concoction that I have yet to appreciate properly.

De Dolle colpisce ancora, con una strong ale bruna con un carattere di ferro, imbattibile! Laroma è molto profumato e ha un leggero sentore acido-acetico da birra vinosa. Il gusto si rivela prevalentemente dolce ma complesso, snodandosi lungo una gamma di note fruttate con fichi e frutta rossa e qualcosina (mi sembra) che tende allamaro. Lalcol si annida pericolosamente in ogni sorso, ma tutto sommato la bevuta risulta piacevole e relativamente leggera.

A nice, pink-red like beer with a slightly brown layer of foam. It has a sweet-sour aroma like a kriek-lambiek beer. The taste however, is quite bitter with a touch of licorice. The aftertaste is also quite bitter and hangs on for a while.

Een mooi, rood-rose bier met een lichtbruine kraag. Het aroma is zoetzurig als een kriek-lambiek. De smaak daarentegen is bitter en iets dorpachtig. De nasmaak is ook vrij bitter en blijft lekker hangen.

Appearance: Clear dark brown with ruby highlights and 3 finger thick ivory head.
Aroma: Mineral, boiled sweets, melon, strawberry, band aid and fruity.
Taste: Medium bitterness, low/medium sourness and low sweetness.
Palate: Thick coarse texture, low/medium body, prickly carbonation, dry, abrupt spicy (peppery), bitter and band aid finish, with slight alcohol warmth
Comments: Tasty and glass lace.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Smokey medicinally sweet in the bottle. In the glass it is a reddy murky brown. Initial big head though this thins. Slight fizzy start, some shimmering sweetness with some white pepper qualities. Similar to Chimay Red but longer, more complex & lighter. Elegance with cherry essence end. Almost perfect nose. Beautiful.

Pours murky medium brown with tall, frothy light tan head, basically explodes out of the bottle. Aroma of yeast, pepper, cherries, figs and dates. Taste is lightly cherry sour followed by a sweet warming alcohol finish that lingers. Body is light and crisp with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured a dark reddish brown with a tan head. On the nose are very sweet, honey, maple. On the tongue I get sweetness with a slight bitterness on the back end. Very fizzy with a finish of alcohol. Overall a great beer

bottiglia da 33 CL, colore marrone con sfumature rossastre, schiuma compatta e persistente, al naso si sente molto dolce, corpo non eccessivo con una media carbonazione, si sente molto la liquirizia e la frutta. Molto buona
Aroma: Dried red fruits, liquorice, toasted bread Appearance: Brown, red glow, off white head, medium lace Taste: Dried red fruit, chestnut, toasted bread, lightly sour, quite nice
Fles gedeels met Jeroen, geur is gist wijn en gedroogd fruit. Smaak is eerst zoetzurig met daarna een bitterzure trekkende afdronk die weer aan een droge wijn doet denken. Lekker biertje
Bottle in Bierbrasserie Cambrinus, Brugges. Dark body with a thin tan head. Flavours of red fruit and caramel. Full mouthfeel from the quite high carbonation. Quite a sweet brew and very tastey.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer & Beyond Store. Thanks beerandbeyond for the bottle! Deep brown and almost opaque, frothy, light tan head. Fruity aroma, dried fig. Tastes bitter and nice and again, of dried figs. Full body, fruity bitter finish, a little sour wine. Good.
Le classique de chez De Dolle. Original, plaisant en tout point. Un bon point de départ pour déguster les bières de cette brasserie.

Bottle, pours hazy ruby, tan head. Figgy nose, a little caramel, winter fruit, some raisin and berry. Taste follows, with a little more raisin, some residual sugars. Big, highly carbonated mouthfeel. Excellent, challenging.
Dark bordeaux beer with beautiful firm white collar. Perfect harmony of licht sour, delicate sweet and bitter. Hints of prunes, dates, figs and chestnuts.

Bottle from Appellation Wines - Cheers Ash! Pours dark brown with a big rocky white head. Aromas of dark stone fruit, christmas cake, orange peel, slight boozy note. Some spice from the yeast. Taste brings forth more fruitiness, and orange peel, and then liquorice. Gets better with every sip.

33cl bottle. Color: dark brown with a huge white head. Nose: caramel, chocolate, sweet malts, Taste: very complex, smooth, very well balanced. Palate: is sugerish, slightly alcoholic, very warm, long lasting. I forgot how good this beer is, very nice!

Hazy deep ruby appearance with medium head. Fruity, sweet, malty aroma with plums and strong cherry scent. Sweet on the mouth with very rich palate. High alcohol is very well hidden. Outstanding Belgian strong ale style beer.

Bottle at craft ale house. Pours clear reddish copper with an immense off white head. The aroma has a lot of tart notes, light brown sugar, light funky fruity esters. The taste has a big dark fruit sweetness, brown sugar, fig, raisin, plum. Delicious.
One of my absolute favourite beers. Drunk from 33 cl bottle bought at malting pot in Brussels. A sweet sour sharp taste full of flavour. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2014 The longest-finishing beer that Ive ever tasted-- at least 15 seconds. Tastes a bit like cider, but oh so much more complex. The most interesting beer money can buy.

Head: off-white foam. Colour: clear darm amber. Aroma: fruity, prunes, grapes, malt. Taste: medium bitter turning sweet. Palate: alcoholic, full bodied finish, lively CO2. Overall: very nice.
Never change a winning team it was good 5 years a go and still stays ok and more that than

Dunkel caramel braun, trün, dichter weisser schaum, malz, caramel und leichte säure im aroma, antrunk gehaltvoll, caramel, starke rezenz, feinherb, ganz leichte säure

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Tørst, NYC. Pours clear ruby with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of fruit and alcohol with nites of flowers and caramel malt and a touch of wine. Heavy, boozy flavour og good, oak aged wine with notes of malt, caramel and coffee. Warming alcohol presence. mildly sourish aftertaste. Well-balanced and just delicious.

Bottle at home, thanks to an IP trade with Belgbeergeek, 30/09/13. Time to catch up on an old friend!
Pours extremely dark brown with a good sized light tan head.
Nose is dark fruits, sugars, brown bread, slightly oxidised notes at first but these seemed to fade about half way through drinking.
Taste comprises rich dark fruits, figs, dates, light spice, dark toffee, light boozey tones, brown sugars, earthy tones, tobacco.
Overall a pretty decent Belgian Strong, not to sweet !The alcohol is evident to an extent but pretty well integrated.
Id happily return to this one - decent stuff.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Det här var gott, riktigt gott. Smaken var söt med toner av sviskon och belgisk jäst, balansen var fin och väl avvägd och kroppen var stabil.
Hade bara aromen varit lite kraftigare hade det blivit en 10a. Mycket trevlig öl med fin balans i kropp och smak.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Caramel to orange in color... Brown sugar aroma, slightly yeasty, sweet malts dominate the flavor, notes of alcohol... Not particularly bitter on finish ... Pretty solid beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Reddish brown color with a nice off-white head. Aroma is complex, brown sugar, caramel, dark fruits, vinous and alcohol notes. Flavor is like the aroma, complex as well but not much alcohol perception. Medium body and carbonation, sweet finish, very good surprise!

UPDATED: MAR 13, 2015 Pours a beautifully dark amber/red wine-ish colour with a creamy beige head. Nose and taste are candy sweet and light sour, and have malty honey and caramel, spices and some dried fruits (plums, raisins) to it too. Relatively high carbonation, good body. Not too balanced flavourwise, too sweet.
Love the bottle, pours a nice dark bown beer + good head of lobby foam. Taste´s of cherry, caramel, stroop, Good balance, not too sweet. Nice warming beer.

On tap at Holy Grale, Louisville KY. Short description: wine like. My normal beer is a IPA but this caught me in the right mood. I loved it. It pours dark ruby. the head is beige and small. The aroma is malty. The taste is sweet and malty,a little sour, just light. Not too fruity like most Belgians

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2014 Je crois quavec cette brasserie je suis pas objectifs, cette bière frise la perfection, une mousse magnifique, délicate en bouche avec une attaque sur le sucre candy puis le caramel elle fini avec un goût de banane et de poivre. Ca tue sa race !!!!!

Bottled September 2012 poured into snifter. 
Amber rust color with a light cream head which dissipated slowly when poured vigorously.
Scent of dark fruit/cherry with a little boozy malt.
Taste is cherry raisin current caramel.
Highly carbonated to the tongue. Nice finish of alcohol yet drier than most strong ale which makes this all the more enjoyable.
Overall like this strong ale a lot. Not too sweet & excellent blend of flavor.

Pours a rusty ruby brown with two fingers of gaseous khaki foam. The nose is roasted caramel, ripe fruit and some esters and spice. The palate follows with a complex array of dark fruits plum, cherry, raisin along with a tangy tartness and round caramelized sugars. Dry bubbly finish !

shared a bottle some time ago, pours with a hazy amber colour with a huge white head. a lot of dark fruits in the aroma. you can also notice some plums. slight bitter and sweet aswell. a bit boozy like almost all the dolle beers. great mouthfeel

A very good fruit beer. Pours a muddy amber color. Smells like green apples. Taste has a lot of strawberries, and some more green apple. Not too sweet, and not too sour. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

It pours dark (almost opaque) mahogany with ruby highlights; the head is beige and mousse-like. The aroma has notes of: plums, dark fruits, rum, pumpernickel bread, and alcohol. The taste is medium sweet that finishes lightly sour and medium bitter; there are notes of: all aforementioned aroma notes, and lemon juice. The palate is full-bodied, has low-carbonation, is sticky, and has a long finish. Overall, its a pretty darn tasty big bootied Belgian.

Ambrée foncée trouble, pétillance moyenne, col beige fin. Malts caramel, légèrement métallique, belles notes de fruits (pruneaux et autres fruits noirs), moyennement épicée et houblonnée, onctueuse au palais. Un bon plaisir!
Bottle A: red fruits, caramel. App: Hazy brown thick beige head. T/p: med body acidic and medium finish. O: nice like the acidic touch.
11oz bottle pours reddish brown with a thin head. Caramel and dried fruit aroma and taste.

Gusher... With extreme carbonation. Possibly from being in backpack for a 3 mile bike ride. Intriguing aromas and flavors. Very port like. Vinous raisin aromas and flavors... Concentrated vanilla oak and spice flavors.. Semi-sweet cherry/prune juice.. Mild nuttiness.. Pretty cool.. Mildly sour.. Medium bodied. Very wine like for sure! ...never thought I'd really think that. Awesome stuff. Even though this had extreme carbonation, it was pretty awesome stuff once settled in the glass. Worth trying for sure.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

How: Bottle.
Where: De Dolle brewery.
Appearance: Dark brown/reddish colour with a brown head.
Aroma: Hops, malt, caramel.
Body: Medium body with an ok carbonation.
Flavour: Malt, caramel, fruit, spices.
Comment: A good beer. Hard to notice the alcohol.

Bottled June 2013, poured August 2013. Pours a deep dark hazy reddish brown with a massive off white head. Took a while to get this whole beer into my glass. Aroma of plums and figs, cherries, pears, some hops, and lots of yeasty dryness. Flavor has a nice up front bitter that fades into prunes and yeast flavor. A bit of tart yeast lingers. Bubbly and prickly carbonation makes this lighter than I expected. Solid brew, though I like my Belgians a little sweeter than this. Nice balance overall.

Small head. Stale cara-crystal malty notes. Faint hop malty bitterness. Dried prunes. Sharp tart taste and a tart dry long finish. Complex
Murky dark brown with 2 finger off white foamy head. Sour nose. Tastes of coffee, wood, chocolate, malty dark fruit sweetness. Good deep complex beer.

Bottle cellared at home for year. 

Pours with a thick beige head fluffy head. A murky brown colour with hint of red. Full rich flavor of mild cherries, wine, malty with a final pop of mild alcohol and slightly sweet finish. An excellent beer. 

As a side note I picked up this beer at the brewery on a trip there last year. One of the most interesting ones to date. Tour headed by the brewmaster, who wears a bowtie like the one on the bottle. Got to go into the fermentation room, where a batch was foaming away in open tanks. Amazing! If youre ever in Brugge or Lille its worth the side trip, and not that far from Westvleteren. Hint-hint.

Pours murky brown with medium finger thick brown white head
Very nice aromas of cherries, mud, fudge, oak, belgo yeast
Taste is. Wee bit acidic but has a very nice smooth body built up with molasses, cherries, barley, wee bit oak

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Dark amber color with a thick creamy tan head that leaves a fine lacing.Aroma: Fruity, balanced sweet malty, yeast and raisin.Palate: Medium to full body. Mild round sweetness and a moderate bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Vinous, fruity, some acidic yeast and malty. Well hidden and warming alcohol.Overall impression: A fine and very well balanced Belgian strong ale. Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with workmate Gundersen.

Enigmatic aroma of toffee, vanilla cask, and red wine barrel funk all together. Impenetrable brown with brown sea foam head which takes forever to collapse. Very tart flavor, has the approximate metallic bloodiness of skunked merlot with spicy kick. Dry and papery feel, also obviously strong. A heavy, complex beer and somewhat tricky to get through. Bottled 10/2011. Too old or just barely legal?

Pours cloudy orangish brown with a large loose tan head that crackles yet stays aloft. Smell is wood, a touch of caramel, dark fruit, some tartness. Taste is Wow!...All the flavors mentioned in the smell intermingle all at once with a touch of chocolate and vanilla on the dry ending. Tart, sweet and complex. Body is light/medium and a bit oily carbonation in crisp and a touch course. This is one hell of a beer!

Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Brewed February 2011.Pours a medium-cloudy dark reddish brown. Decent amount of tan head. Aroma rich, notes of cherry and chocolate malt. Body rich, boozy, finish malty, rich and maybe a bit spicy. Not too shabby.
Old sample from Kris Herteleer. My alltime favourite beer. Now my taste is more into lighter beer. Still the quality is excellent.

UPDATED: JUL 31, 2015 light sour aroma,brown, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, oily feel, fizzy, light liquier fizzy,sour finish.7/11/13-5-3-7-3-12=3.
sweet caramel,licorice and fig. red ,hazy, tan foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, light licorice alcoholic finish.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with white head. Malt, raisins, bread, dry fruits aroma. Malty, sweet taste, with dark fruits, slightly sour. Medium body.

UPDATED: DEC 20, 2013 33cl bottle.
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, nice stable beige head. Little gusher though...
NOSE: burned malts, plum, some wood, red grapes, almost like red wine? somewhat sweet.
TASTE: wow! very nice sweetness balanced about with a slight fruity alcoholic aftertaste! Goes down smoothly. Amazing beer!

Achetée à Saveur Drink, Une incroyable mousse dense et persistante qui surmonte une belle robe brune. Arômes de caramel et de prune, saveurs fruitées et boisées, notes vineuse. Final acidulé. Un grand classique !

The foam of this beer is wonderfull, stays very long, and remains thick. It has a sour flavour, which is also appearing in the taste. It is a very open beer for his kind. The taste is fruity, and the alcohol is masker very well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Aromas van azijnzuur, bloemen en zure melk vormen een complexe geur die leidt naar fruitige nasmaak die lang doorzindert en de indruk wekt van hout rijping, zonder een barrel gezien te hebben.

Really neat little sour brown beer with a light brown pour and a beige head. The nose has a light fruity aroma with slight sourness and a bit of roasted malts. Sweet caramel and fruity flavours with a light pervasive sourness. Very well balanced and complex plus its super unique.

Cerveza oscura y con espuma densa. Olor afrutado, piña y algo floral. Sabor especiado, picante, grano de cafe, chocolateado. Calienta la garganta. Gran cuerpo, gran balance, y perfecta de gas. Muy recomendable. Mejor no muy fria.
Bottle poured in a Teku glass.  Brown with dark red lights, creamy hazel foam. A complex beer perfectly balanced with a sweet end.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2013 330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass at home. ABV 9%
Beautiful colour, something between dark ruby red and caramel/amber brown. Big froathy hed, beige in colour, slowly collapsing leaving no lacing on the glass.
Aroma seems a bit boring at first, with just some caramel in it, but after a swirl of the glass, a bouquet of different aromas surfaces. Smells a bit sour, with white grapes, very wine-y, but after a while the aroma turns to a sweet one, with red grapes this time,caramel and sugars. Some hints of the alcohol as well between sniffs. All in all, very complex aroma.
Great taste, also very wine-like. The complexity is present on the taste as well, with a very light sourness at first, turning quite fast to a mildly sweet taste. Lots of grapes in there, some caramel too on the finish. Very well hidden alcohol.
Medium thin body, good amount of carbonation, really smooth. A tart feeling on the palate.
Overall a fantastic beer, very very complex.

Bottle.  Pours dark brown with maybe a slight amber hue.  Big frothy head that fades normally but never completely goes away.  Fruity aroma, plums, cherries, raisins, and some bread too.  Taste starts with a light sweetness, lots of dark dried fruit.  Finishes with a nice light tartness.  Berries and raisins in the finish.  A little foamy and fizzy in the mouthfeel but it goes away so fast that it doesnt bother me much.  Medium to thick body.  Overall, its a very nice Belgian Strong.  I think I would like this better with some age on it.  Carbonation would fade and the flavors would get richer.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2013 Pours slightly cloudy amber little head no lacing. Lots of plum, cereal, some light English tea. Really nice!

Tastes are light/med sweet. Full body, not quite creamy more like milk, and light carbonation.

Bottle @ home. profumo intenso quasi vinoso, molto avvertibile il lievito. Sentori anche di caramello, di mou e di tarte tatin alle pere. Il colore è marrone scuro, con riflessi rossi. non del tutto torbida , ma piuttosto opaca con una schiuma pannosa non molto compatta e non troppo stabile.
Il gusto è speciale, sa di malto tostato ma in maniera piacevolennte dolce, sa di burro & zucchero, ha un bellissimo luppolato rotondo, non astringente. 
é molto complessa, e di corpo pieno che impegna bene la bocca. finale lunghissimo.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown color with a fairly thick light tan head. Nose is actually a little lighter than I expected, but has dark fruit elements and just  a hint of sweetness coming through. Taste is actually a tad sour to me with the dark fruitiness coming through.

Bottle. Light hazy chestnut brown with a huge bubbly beige head. Seems alcoholic on the nose with some caramel and berries underneath. Feels lighter on the palate than I expected and not alcoholic until a warming finish. Notes of brown sugar, light toffee, light dark fruits, dusty/moldy, nuts. Pretty short and light finish. Taste is medium sweet and light/medium bitter. Medium body, oily/sticky texture, lively carbonation.

33 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet. Pours deep red with a large beige head that is fizzy. Aroma of roasted malts and dark dried fruits. Flavor is sweet and bitter. A bit infected this one ? Some acid notes. Strange.

Hazy red-brown with ludicrous tan head.  Wonderful aroma, strong bready malt, caramel, red fruits, esters.  Medium full body, minimal alcohol, slight carbonation.  Rich pleasantly sweet flavor, malty molasses, yeasty, spice, chocolate, I dont really notice much tartness but no matter, excellent beer.

On tap at the brewery. Dark hazy toffee color. Thick off white head. Some lacing. Nice aroma of malt, raisins, a slight roasted chocolate. Sweet malty flavor. Slightly dry. Nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle. Large foamy head (be careful when pouring this beer!), dark brown ruby color, aroma is sour, and taste is sour, bitter and tart with hints of sweet caramel. A challenging beer!  But i like it!

Donker biertje met een cola achtig schuim. Aroma is mouterig en ruikt erg apart en niet erg lekker. Eerste wat bij de slok opvalt is het heftige koolzuur. Bij de tweede slok komt in de smaak goed het gedroogde fruit en abrikozen naar voren. Dit eindigt in een zoete smaak. De nasmaak is wat kruidig en droger, stopt snel ik over te gaan in een tikje bitter. Dit zorgt er voor dat je er lekker lang van geniet.

Bottle. Pours hazy red with a diminishing fizzy huge beige head. Aroma is toasted malt, plums, red apples, candy, estery, cherry, musty, oaky notes, pepper and clove. Taste is light+ sweet, bitter and and acidic. Gives a tingling sensation. Body is medium, texture is light sticky, carbonation is lively. Finish is short, very dry, dusty, warming and acidic. The tip of my tongue became numb drinking this.

Color caralmelo oscuro. Aroma ácido y frutal equilibrado. En boca muestra una acidez afrutada con un final ácido (¿clavo, anís?) bastante marcado.Textura media, pero correctamente carbonatada.  En general, una buena cuádruple.

Bottle at home (april 19, 2013). Ruby red with big offwhite head. Aroma of fruity esthers and must yeast. Sweet dark caramel, some alcohol notes and dark red fruits. Taste is bitter and metallic. Dark red fruits, sourness, caramel, some banana, roasted malts and a hint of coffee. T. Dry and bitter aftertaste. Mouthfeel is medium and a bit sticky on the palate.I do not like the metallic note in this beer.

33.cl bottle at locus publucus deft.
Thick creamy off white head.  Hazy amber pour.  nicesmoothbrew despite the 9%
Light brown, clear.  Aroma of toasty malt, sour cherries, light fruitiness, some nutty and lightly chocolaty notes.  Flavor:  moderately sour, grainy-toasty malt, white raisins, a little chocolate.

11.6 ounce bottle.  Cloudy reddish brown color topped by a small creamy beige head. Earthy, tart fruit malt aroma with notes of yeast and alcohol. Upfront, bittersweet dark malt flavor with notes of dried fruit, roasted red bell peppers and apricots. Nicely balanced by spicy hops and yeasty tartness. All in all, a very flavorful and unique beer.
UPDATED: APR 16, 2013 33CL Bottle at De Fiere Margriet. Neutral aroma ,with a hint of Liquorice (confectionery). light sourish taste. A great beer.
August 2010. From bottle. Pours amber with a white head. Aromas of yeast, mast and spices. Finished a bit sour.

Pours from a 33 Cl bottle. Pours a translucent amber with a thick, lasting beige head of foam. Aroma is sweet and fruity, notes of plum, pineapple, light musty, basement aroma. Theres quite a bit going on in the aroma. Taste is very heavily estery with heavy accents on the cardamom. Grilled pineapple comes through nicely in the taste as well. Earthy sweetness reminiscent of tobacco leaves. Airy, creamy mouthfeel. Subtle carbonation.

March 2012 - room temp young bottle.  Pours with a huge head which dissipates over a few minutes.  Murky red/brown colour.  Smells soapy and malty.  Mild carbonation - the right level for this beer.  Taste - cherries up front with a bit of spice and then raisins in the aftertaste.  Balance of sweetness and sourness is good but both are a bit understated.  I think there is some potential for aging.  Good beer.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Reddish brown pour with super thick and lasting head/lacing. Aromas & flavor of dark fruit, fig, candy sugar, roasty grains, and other various spices. Finishes slightly tart for a Belgian with loads of carbonation. Nice brew from De Dolle but I will always prefer the sour reserve version to this.

havnt rated this one yet ? damn , the last weeks i seem to remember a lot of beers ive had, wich i totaly forgot to rate so far. so yeah, out of memories : 
pours brown, white foam. 
taste is rather sweet, but not too much? carbo is high but ok. taste is overall nice, but no shock

Pours a thick beige head that wont disappear. Aroma is full of spices, figs, prunes and brown sugar. Taste with dark fruits, figs, prunes, caramel, a bit of toffee. Syrupy mouthfeel with a little tart finish. The good carbonation and the little tartness helps on the drinkability wich is very good for beer with a abv that high. Another delicious offering from de dolle.

2012 batch enjoyed in a wine glass. Poured a dark raisin color. Big head and a very slow pour to make this work. Intense carbonation right out of the bottle. Nose is very heavy on the raisins. Hint of yeasty syrup and figs. 
Very delicious. nice balance of sweetness and sort of a red wine taste with some cloves and honey. Nice tart finish.
Bottle. Pours a reddish amber with thick beige head and some lace. Nose of sour cherries, roasted malts, figs, raisin, candi sugar and some funk. Smooth for 9% with a mildly tart finish.

Bottle: Funny thing is that I have had this beer many times in the past. Somehow I never made a note about this. Maybe I did, but it never reached Ratebeer. My taste has evolved in the years, so this is quite an honest and up to date rating. Here it goes:
Big and vast, creamy off white to beige colored foamy head that disappears really slow and leaves a sticky normal sized head on top of a light cloudy beautiful red ruby colored beer.
Aromas of red fruit, soap, vinous, sweeter barleys malts, raisin, rice, oatmeal, toffee, flowery barleys, hints of chalk, toast, toast, bread and toasted sticky herbs.
Flavours of brown sugars, caramelised barley malts, raisin, prunes, toffee, bitters, spices (a teeny tiny hint of alcohol), some toast, red fruit, vinous, light floral and light herbal, some malty bread, yeast and some sticky sweets but overpowered by the bitter and spicy tones.
Aftertaste bitter, some spicy tones, toast, red fruit, sticky sweets with floral tones and bread.
Low carbo, soft creamy foamy lightly blown mouthfeel, full body and a creamy texture.
Forgot that this beer is this good. Quite a complex nose and taste. Nothing wrong with this one.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Reviewed 3/4/13. Bottle says 9%. 11.6 oz bottle into a Duvel tulip.

A: Pours a very dark burnt sienna color. The head is a rather attractive two finger cream color. It features a soft, creamy layer over top some rather thick-looking bubbles. Retention is excellent - even after a couple of minutes the head is one finger high - and a good layer of lacing is left on the glass.

S: Okay, this is interesting...not only are the usual BSDA suspects quite evident (dark fruits, chocolate, pears), a sour undercurrent rests wonderfully below that. I really enjoy the tart cherries, sour apple esters, and general acetic quality as well. The complexity of the aroma isnt overbearing, either.

T: Compared with the first inhalation, the sour quality is far more restrained here, taking on more of a lactic tone. Sadly, the coinciding cherry esters are also downplayed. For a brief glorious moment, sour cherries initiate the profile, before giving way to a chocolaty yet dry midtaste. And now a THIRD element comes along that I didnt foresee - hoppiness. The finish is full of grassy, earthy hops, with touches of leather as well. Certainly, its complex; but at the same time, the complexity is cohesive rather than messy - Im impressed how well balanced the seemingly clashing elements work together. Even if the lack of acetic sourness is a letdown for me, the only thing really wrong here is the slight paper quality in the aftertaste.

M: This one is dry, more so than many others in the style. Given the sour/hop bend of this, it isnt surprising. Lush, creamy, and silky arent terms Id use to describe the texture - more like papery, coarse, and rough - but the firmness also helps make the carbonation seem a little lighter than what it is. I find its semi-abrasive feel endearing, to be frank.

O: A BSDA thats sour and hoppy? Interesting. A BSDA thats sour, hoppy, and isnt a clusterfuck? Now you have my attention. Okay, it doesnt work perfectly and isnt the most chuggable offering...but damn, its just so much fun to sip and contemplate over.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Color mogano scuro con spesso cappello di schiuma beige chiaro. Fruttata, caramellata e acidula al naso; gusto dolciastro e zuccheroso con note di toffee e frutta candita. Corpo medio, effervescenza piacevole e finale agrodolce persistente. Buona birra belga, con un non-so-che di natalizio.

non ricordo molto bene questa birra a causa della serata alcolica molto aggressiva,quindi dovrò sicuramente riassaggiarla..mi limito a dare un voto secondo le cose che ricordo di più ovvero il suo bellaspetto nero-rossastro con una bella schiuma alta e bianca,un aroma molto intenso e speziato e il sapore decisamente maltato con un ottimo amaro in bocca..riprovare!

33cl bottle poured dark brown with medium sized tan head.Yeast,malt,spice,caramel,toffee and sour fruit in both the aroma and the taste.Notes of sweet and sour throughout the taste making a lovely tasting beer.
Et av de bedre øl jeg har smakt. Vanvittig med skum mørk farve, humle og målt i rikelig mengde. Et virkelig toppøl...

11.2 oz of unimpressive possibly infected beer. Poured an inch of muddy brownish burgundy body under several inches of foamy fluffy light beige head. Aroma is metal, copper and dates along with figs, raisins, nuts and dates plus bread dough and walnuts. The palate is actually not bad, medium bodied all around with softer carbonation but finishes with a large metalic note. Flavor is as described with lots of metal and copper notes followed by dates, figs, raisins, walnuts, aluminum foil. Meh itsnot good.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100312.
Pours hazy golden color with a medium head. Aroma of yeast, spices, malts, caramel and toffee. Flavor of yeast, malts, caramel, ripe fruits, some toffee and earth. Excellent.

1.5 year old bottle. Dark chestnut brown with a thick, tan, nice lacy head that settles to a thin lasting top. Had to wait as the head was super thick and needed to settle. Super intense deep smell of toasted malt, caramel, molasses and some roasted toasted malt elements. Seems complex and spicy like a whiskey with a bit of alcohol. Nice fine frothy full body with soft carbonation. The taste starts of toasted malt, sugar cane and caramel mixed with slightly sour dark fruit  plums and oranges and a bit of alcohol on the finish.  Moves from sweet to sour. Very smooth and nice but the alcohol and the acid sourness lingers. Low bitterness but still nice.

Imported through the SAQ. Pours a hazy copper-brown colour that gives out a red-orange glow. Huge beige head that is foamy, has very, very long retention with some bubbly lace. Aromas of sweet sugars, dark fruity malts, caramel and mild spices. Smooth and silky mouthfeel, almost creamy. Again, sweet tasting with some mild, but sharp hop bitterness that blends things well. Flavours of apples, butterscotch, dark fruits, notes of licorice, hints of cherries and with a tad of tartiness in the aftertaste. This brew has a beautiful sweetness to it that is not overkill, but very well-balanced with many fruits. Gets better as you drink it... slowly.

Poured clear reddish amber with a good fizzy head.  Fruity malt aroma,  Flavor is malty cherry or other stone fruit.  The body is light and the ABV deceptive.   Just a hint of bitterness at the finish.   Not bad but not a favorite style for me.

Bottle shared by Mike 
Appearance: Hazy amber with a small off-white head and some lacing 
Aroma: Tart fruit and some sweetness, yeast 
Taste: Tart fruit and some acidic sourness  
Ok
This is a really good Belgian Strong, but it doesnt have that uniqueness that sets it apart.  Is fairly dry, has the typical body and appearance of the style, and has nice carb.

2013.01.29 - De Dolle Oerbier - 11.2oz bottle in goblet glass.  Bottle cap marked "bottled JUNE2012".

Pours a lovely deep brown, dark chestnut perhaps.  Thick foamy bubbling caramel head, probably 1.5 inches and takes several minutes to settle.

Aroma is malty sweetness and bready Belgian yeast to me.

Mouthfeel is medium, a bit creamy, perhaps from the foamy head that is left. Medium carbonation.

Taste is nice.  Dark malty sweetness, a bit of spice or bitter. Balance of bitter and sweetness.  Repeat purchase worthy but not necessarily exceptional.

Aroma 7/10, Appearance 4/5, Taste 7/10, Palate 3/5, Overall 16/20

Enjoyed a bottle at Cafe Bruges, Carlisle.  Very carbonated, had to swirl in the glass before drinking.  no big deal though, it was a wonderful brown ale with mild sourness.  loved the glass and yellow man.
Pours a hazy dark brown.Creamy, stout-like, slightly sour. Full body. Fully met expectations. Very nice indeed.

A fizzy amber beer with an ephemeral head.  The aroma is mild red grape and faint french toast.  The flavor is similar to the aroma with a moderate malty presence.  Low bitterness.  Tangy and warming.  A sipper with a smooth finish.

Intensas notas vinosas, fuertes, alcholicas; Asi como un complejo aroma frutal (Uvas).

Color obscuro, opaco, Reminisencias rubís a contra luz, carbonatación baja, cuerpo completo, redonda, corona de espuma media de retención alta.

En boca picante, vinosa, dulce y frutal.

Al paladar es una cerveza genial, intensa, unica y compleja. Vinosa, akcholica, muy frutal, ligeramente acida y con un final largo.

Una cerveza genial en resumen. Exquisita, muy frutal y potentalcholica, la cual se disfruta con moderación.

Botella. Color ambar oscuro con espuma densa y persistente. Aroma a cafe frutos rojos, especias levaduras. Sabor dulce acido muy buen equilibrio con notas de cafe, compleja y muy sabrosa, cuerpo alto y carbonatacion media.

aatuu lasiin sameana ja punaruskeana, vaahto on (panimolle tyypillisesti?) runsas ja pitsinen. Haju on melko mieto, josta löytyy selkeäsi kirsikkaa joukossa. Maku on mausteinen, hiilihappoinen ja hyvin kirpeän sitruksinen, kirsikka ei maistu niin hirveästi. Suutuntuma on keskitäyteläinen ja hiilihappoinen. Kokonaisuutena voisi sanoa, että onhan belgiale vaan hyvää!

330 ml bottle. Bottled Apr/2011. BB Apr/2013. From bierzwerg.de.
Dark reddish brown colour with average to big creamy light tan head. 
Amazing aroma of sourness, sweetness and maltiness. Perfectly balanced. Flavour is dark fruits, sugary sweetness, mild sourness, soy, mild hoppy bitterness and malt. Nicely balanced. Absolutely brilliant beer.

A dark ruby red ale with a champagne white head. Notes of dark plum and fermented raspberry lure you in. The flavors are dark and malty. There is a bit of texture to the unfermentable sugars still present in the beer. And surprisingly there is no sourness but a bit of IBUs to finish. Thank you to the brewer 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy dark amber colour, beige head. Aroma of cherry, rye bread, caramel, light hops, raisins, quite a bit of malts and quite a big yeast profile. Flavour is sweet, light bitter with liquorice touches. Bitter finish, cherry, quite strong alcohol touch.
(From 33cL bottle @ Het Brouwershuis, Baarle-Hertog)

15/12/2012 Grande esposizione della birra fiera di Roma - alla spina.
Scura, ricca di sentori.
Non proprio beverina ma godibile.

Bottle. Hazy dark brown body with a dense tan head. Aroma/taste: a sweet, spicey aroma, with a taste of dried raisins and chocolate with a late chocolatey bitter finish. The flavour of the beer grows with the drinking. Light to medium bodied.
12 ounce bottle. Lots of carbonation in pour. Yeasty and tangy. Caramel and apple. Red wine. Very nice.

Bottle @ home... It pours hazy dark brown with a maxium large beautiful fluffy tan head.... The Aroma is sweet malts, spices, caramel and fruits... the flavor is nice dark fruits, spices, alcohol and caramel....

Aged bottle from cellar - guessing about 5 years on this one (couldnt find a date on the bottle)...nice whoosh after opening with some carbonation evident...pours deep, murky mahogany with a thin off-white head that settles into a lasting film.  Aroma is enticing - brown sugar, dark fruits, sweet malts, hint of brandy - delicious!  Flavor is quite good as well, just doesnt stand up to the aroma...sweet flavor with some caramel, booze and fruit.  Palate is actually nicely carbonated for the age on this bottle - solid offering and one I would never turn down...

Slight gusher! Pours a mahogany-colored beer with high, long-lasting off-white head. It smells very malty, slightly roasty, caramelly, with some plum. Starts sweet and malty, lots of dark fruit, paired with caramel, toffee and candy. The middle part is subtly alcoholic, very malty-caramelly, again with plenty of dark fruits and some brown sugar. Goes into a alcoholic-warming finish with a lot of dark fruit and a very sweet malt flavor!!

Pours a beautiful dark red hue, HUGE creamy off-white head, awesome!  Smell is candied fruits, brown sugar, a little bit of booze.  Taste is more of the same.  This is a great beer, worth seeking out!
From a 33 cl bottle shared at home.  Bottled Feb 2011.  Pours a hazy brown with a very thick tan head.  Toffee and yeast nose.  Sweet raisin and tart green apple.  Slight bitter finish.  Nice beer.
I thought I had already reviewed this one. Great brew, this is one of my favorite Belgian strong darks. Great dark fruit notes warming in the stomach thick and chewy just what I like

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2015 Bottle at Eulogy. Red brown pour. Foamy off-white head. Huge aroma. Big chewy caramel malt mixed with complex red fruit flavors. Raisins. Figs. Dates. Pomegranate. Plums. Caramel apples. Pecan pie. Dried cranberries. Candied orange peel. Wildflower honey. Really great stuff. One of my two "go to" Belgium bottles (Pannepot being the other one.) This one is nice because it always changes a bit batch to batch and year to year. Also ages quite well. Some years have been better than others. The 2012 vintage is looking great. Start with it a little chilled then watch how the flavor develops as it warms. Not as dense as the "Extra Export" or aged "Still Nachts" but the regular Oerbier always seems the most fun! UPDATE: August 2014. Having the new 2014  brew at Monks. Rich but notably tart compared to previous years. Still (always) great stuff! UPDATE: Nov 2015 at a Khyber Pass anniversary event. Having on draft for the first time. Juicier than in the bottle but still maintains its rich dark malty goodness. My understanding is that De Dolle may have changed brewery locations in the past few years leading to similar but more consistent and refined versions of its recipes. This draft version is notably "cleaner" than the past versions I have had. Bottles have now become difficult to come by and I need to get a hold of a recent vintage to see if there is indeed a brew-wide change.

33cl bottle at Belgian Beer Cafe, Eureka Tower, Melbourne. Pours red- brown with a decent off white head providing a good lace. Notes of burnt sugar, toffee, raisins, soft spices and alcohol on the nose. Mainly sweet malts on the tongue with balancing hop bitterness and a thickish texture. Medium long finish. Enjoyed this one.

Bottle.  Estimated to be a 2005.  Pours a muddy brown red with a one finger brown head that resides quickly to nil.  Smell is bright raisins, plum wine, sweet honey, speckles of brown sugar, caramel.  Taste is initially a bit muddled due to some more than minor oxidation, but then lends itself to burnt brown sugar, plums, raisins, other dark aged fruit, more toffee.  Its a shame that this particular bottle is past its prime, but there still is a shell of a nice beer here.  Unfortunately there were a couple of questionable years of care on this bottle that could have added to its demise.

Pours brown or maroon with a big, frothy tan head.  Nose is toffee, cider vinegar, a bit of barnyard and belgian yeast.  Tastes of apple cider, malt, raisins, and toffee.  Great mouthfeel.  This reminds me a lot of the Rochefort 10, but I dont know if I like it quite that much.  Regardless, an excellent, excellent beer.
UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Bottle. Deep orange-brown pour with a creamy head. Nutty, caramel, dark fruit, some cherry, and yeast. Excellent beer.

pours cloudy light brown-reddish, some sediments, with a nice off-white head, some retention and lacing. burnt caramel, toffee, yeasty, spicy, warming alcohol, hint of acidity, hint of raisins, woodiness, some vinous character. lively and soft carbonation, light to medium body - oily, very nice grassy medium long finish. a nice one.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours very dark brown with a thick, lacy, beige head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, caramel and some toffee from the malts, dark fruits, floral hops, and hints of alcohol.  Flavor the same, with everything blending nicely.  Smooth texture.  A really good Belgian beer.

Dark red-brown, the small head is fully diminishing. Aroma is spiced, nutty and with some caramel. Flavour leaves a moderate sour and sweet feeling in the mouth, with lively carbonation and  an alcoholic finish.

Difficult to describe this beer in English, as that is not my native laquage. Its great! Near a Rochfort 8. So to continue in Dutch: een goed bier, met een steveig alcohol toon/effect. Ideaal voor tijdens een verkoudheid.

Opaque, murky brown with a quickly disappaiting head. Spiced figs on the nose. More on the palate, blending with red currant and orange peel. Lively mouthfeel and a whisper of alcohol heat on the finish.

Tasted from 11.6 Belgian brown bottle into a snifter. It poured a cloudy, deep burgundy color (oddly more purplish than any beer Ive seen) with very thin ring of peristent bubbles, no foam or lace. Aromas of oxidized malt, medium caramel, rotting fruit, active compost bin, soy sauce; no hops of yeast character. Flavor was old too: cardboardy like an off-Dubbel. High, hot alcohol. Some residual sweetness, tartness, and lactic sourness. Medium body, low carbonation. I really wish I knew how old this bottle was. Alas, there was no date. Oh, how I wanted to like this beer. I couldnt even learn anything about the unique DeDolle yeast strain Ive heard so much about because the stale beer flavors were all over the place. Boo.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2014 Deep black with red undertones but it is truly dark! Aroma is red fruits (?) and candi. I heard it gets a bit sour with age and I can report that it feels like its for real (this bottle is 1.25 year old). Taste is a little sour with darker fruits and not so much sweetness. Nice beer to cellar like a lot of De Dolles (<3 Stille Nacht sooo much! This one is a good second place).  I wish I could have tasted it when they still used that Rodenbach strain. (3.7)

2014-01-25: Definitely more tart, think some acid red grapes. Awesome! (3.9)

Bottle from Russell and Kristys Pub. Pours dark brown with a thin khaki head that doesnt leave any lacing. Notes of raisin and molasses on the nose. Fairly thick mouthfeel. The molasses is a bit more prominent on the tongue and it lingers a bit on the finish. Im not really feeling this one. I was hoping for more spectacular.

Porządne mocne Ale belgijskie. Ciemny machoniowy kolor z bordowymi refleksami. Spory i mocny kożuch gęstej piany tworzy się błyskawicznie i utrzymuje się do końca picia. W smaku jest drożdżowe i owocowo-wytrawne. Trochę przeszkadza zbyt intensywna woń alkocholowa. W przełyku rozgrzewa

A - Very dark brown, very little light shines through at the top of the beer to reveal a faint hue of yellow. The head lasted most of the beer and was a nice fluffy even pillow.

S - Sweet and sour candy sugar, dark raisin Bread, thats spicy and yeasty with a touch of sour at the end.

T - Raisin Bread, dark fruits, yeast, toffee, roasted malt, pepper, coriander and some slight acidity that balances everything out perfectly and left my palette refreshed and my mouth salivating for more. Full of flavor and a very unique beer, one of the few that brings you on a trip through a range of wonderful flavors.

M &D - Light to Medium bodied and quite effervescent. Soft on the tongue and very easy to drink. I know the alcohol is there but it did not affect the drinkability at all. Could drink this all night.

Bottle of unknown vintage, cheers to Humlelala for this tasty extra.
Bit of a gusher, agate color, lacy white head.  Aromas of red wine, caramel malt.  Big red wine flavor, oak, somewhat dry, and a bit overcarbed.  After having other aged De Dolle offerings, I am guessing this beer gets amazing with age.  I suspect this one was fresher, still good, but not amazing.
Pours reddish with thin white head.  Smells sweet, like molasses.  First taste is of maple syrup (Im from Vermont, btw) with a bit of hops and spice.  Very bubbly and a bit dry on the finish.
Great combination of dark flavors while maintaining a nice balance.  First rate.

33cl bottle, date on back appears to be "1/2010". Hazy red / brown color. Big loud foamy light brown head. Nice smooth texture. Lighter carbonation, dry finish. Little loose lace. Sort of a sweet taste, bit of bitter, some booze, little acidic bite. Good aroma - raisin, spices, chocolate, very interesting and complex aroma. Brew gets much better as it sits and warms up, improves as I go, and alcohol becomes much less noticeable. Some tartness to the taste, light earthy hops, wood. Candi sugar, cherry. Nice and interesting one to sip.

Amazing, simply put. Small batch, 5gal, so delicious. Made with a ton of rich, bold, creamy/grainy malt. Combined with all kinds of elements to make this a rich fulfilling heroic beer. The yeast is the real winner here. I dont know about the hops but it does has great balance. The yeast is spicy, forms great head, good attenuation, great head retention, nice legs, this is what beer dreams are made of...I hope to someday brew at this standard

Dark brown reddish pour with off white head. Aroma is fruity and nutty, lots of plums, walnuts, belgian yeast, candi, a tad winey some cherry notes. Taste is cherry, some alcohol notes quite winey, drinks a little like port. Palate is rich and very well carbed. Quite nice.

The bottle gave me a start when it spat upon opening, but thankfully it didnt fizz like a bottle of New Years champagne. It pours a dark cinnamon brown with a thick, fluffy and rather persistent light tan head. Strong, malty aroma has a firm overtone of sourish apple. Malty, fruity flavor has - WOW! quite an alcohol kick; its almost like vodka mixed with good cider. Still, the malty note and hint of hops that declare this to be beer come through. Smooth texture has good body and plenty of fizz, and yes, that alcohol bite.

A: Chestnut brown with a generous gushing head and decent lacing.

S: Nutty, malty, Belgian yeast.

T: A fine brew. Buttery and smooth, with toffee and Belgian yeast flavors. This beer is not overly complex and pretty easy to drink. There is a nice lingering aftertaste of yeast, bread, toffee.

M: A touch too thin. Carbonation level is ok, with a slight alcoholic finish.

D: A solid BSDA Id be happy to drink again.
2012 - 06 - 25 330ml bottle. ruby-brown colour. big foamy off-white head. lots of carbonation. dark fruits in aroma. light sweet taste. alcohol in palate.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Almost clear, deep brown/red liquid with minimal off-white head. Aroma of dark fruit, toffee, caramel, light fruity belgo esters and some light lacto/vinegar. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter and very light sourness with notes of toffee and dark fruit. Medium to full bodied with low to medium carbonation. Nice Belgian Strong Ale.
Deep coppery brown in color with a huge and fizzy tan head. Strong, deep flavor of raisin, cherry, and dark malt with a hint of bitterness that builds. Very nice.
Quite confounded by this - candied trappist strong leavened by mild souring red. Drying, effervescent, fig and vine fruit

Backlog 2010.
Particular yeast
Full bodied and high complexity.
Very enjoyable.
Pours dark amber with a high head. Aroma is malts, dark fruits, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is malts, alcohol, grapes and some yeast. Quite nice indeed.

11.2 oz bottle purchased at Hill Farmstead brewery.  Pours a deep, clear rusty copper color with a medium sized foamy cream colored head.  Aroma of dates, prunes, plums, figs, brown sugar and Belgian yeast.  Taste of dates, figs, brown sugar, prunes, plums and Belgian yeast.

Takes awhile to open, this one.  Aroma is nestled in the glass.  Nettles and spices dominate, love it.  Rich malts and sugary undertones in the taste.  Mouthfeel excellent.  Not as stunning as the riserva but still damn good.

A - pours dark amber with high fluffy head that disappears. S - dark wintery aromas toasted malts, maple candy, brown sugar.  Spices, cIoves and cinnamon. Strong bitter citrus when swirled. M - average carb trong bodied full palate beer. Nice warm ending. Lingering dark malty end. Interesting tang on the palate. T - dark toasty malts, maple and brown sugar. Tangy citrus, antiseptic, herbal , toffee on the palate. Lingering dark malty end. O - pretty good herbal dark strong Belgian. 7

Pours rich amber with thick tan head. Aromas of mint, candyfloss, molasses, some herbal notes. Flavour is very sweet, thick body, burnt sugar/caramel, walnuts and a slight pepper in the finish. Very nice.

Pours a deep reddish brown with super foamy, long-lasting head. Nose has hints of spice even mint, floral and dried fruit. Flavor has sweet malts and dried fruits. Very drinkable even at 9% ABV.
Despite other users reviews, my bottle had no tart qualities whatsoever.
Bottle 33 cl at trappistenhuis. Poors dark amber with good white head. Aroma is malt sweet nice. Taste sour, good bitter, fruity. Nice beer.
Tap at DØE. Brown colour with a nice off-white head. Aroma and flavour of caramel, malt, yeast, fruit and with floral notes.
10cl sample at Fairbar Aarhus. Smells like sweet fruits and flowers. Rather sweet. Taste is pretty much alike, but is really hoppy though. Easy beer to drink, but easy beer to appreciate too!
Donkerbruin, snel verdwijnende kraag die als een randje aanwezig blijft. Ruikt zoetzurig. Medium body.  Smaakt  zoetzuurbitter.  Niet zo geweldig.

June 2009: Brown 33cl bottle (9%) with very little life left according to the top.

Teak reddy-brown colour and with a little haziness, my own fault, the huge tanned head that appeared as I poured suprised me and i took my eyes off the bottle and some of the sediment got out and into the glass.

The aroma is so Belgian, the yeast smells just ride over you.

Spicey, alcoholic and not very hoppy, just like the style is supposed to be.

Rich and fairly smooth for a Belgian Ale, no bad traits at all.

Very drinkable, but remember the 9% alcohol content before you go crazy on it.
From tap. Pours a red brown with light head. Light malt and dark fruit aromas. Slightly sour taste with fruit, wood barrel, and red wine notes. Well balanced.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours brown/red, with huge off-white head, nice lacing. Aroma is of malt, dark fruits and yeast. Taste is of malt, yeast, sligth dark fruits. A good beer.

Bottle 330 ml. Appearance: Pours dark amber with almost no head (off-white/orange). Aroma: Strong notes of caramel, candy sugar, malt, caramel, molasses. Taste: Sweet, sour, acidic, floral and herbal. Acidic. Overall: Taste isnt as good as aroma. Complex but miss some balance. Could benefit from aging.

Pours deep totally hazy reddish brown with an off white head and great retention.  Not quite as much foam as the other De Dolle brews Ive enjoyed recently.  Aroma is dried fruit: raisin, plum, dates, currants, some acetic undertones, caramel, and the ever-present candy sugar.  Taste is dates, figs, sweet caramel, some forest flowers, candi sugar.  Body is medium, super expansively frothy, long tart finish with a hint of sweetness before the dryness sets in.  Overall, a unique Belgian ale that really exhibits a huge dry red fruit character.
Bottle. Reddish brown. Malts, currants and raisins, plums, caramel, dark sugars, alcohol.

Botella de 330ml.Copa de Vino. Saboreada en abr´12. Color marrón oscuro. Espuma beige, corona persistente, cremosa y esponjosa.  Aroma floral intenso, hierba fresca y brezo. Notas avinadas y de malta caramelo. Sabor muy agradable, especiado, amargo-dulzón, picante y con un cálido tono alcohólico. Cuerpo pleno e intenso, carbonatación moderada. Final de dulce malteado. Sabrosa para un trago pausado.
330ml bottle. Oversized glass. Enjoyed on apr´12. Dark brown in color. Beige froth, lasting creamy & foamy crown. Intense floral fragancy, wet grass & heather aromas. Vinous with caramel malt hues. Pleasant flavor, spicy, sweet/sour, peppery with a warming ABV sensation. Full body, moderate carbonation. Sweet malty finish. Flavorful in a paused drinking moment.
Poured into Oerbier glass. Wow !! this is really unique, very special indeed, a deep complex dark red with redcurrants, blackcurrants maybe even a vintage bordeaux wine. Super good.

Bière brune-rousse opaque coiffée dune belle mousse fine et crémeuse. Nez raffiné, ça sent les dattes séchées, les figues séchées, les raisins secs, mais aussi la cerise, ainsi quune pointe de muscade. Lorsque je porte le verre à mes lèvres, tout de suite le goût me rappelle la tarte aux raisins de ma mère dans sa version où elle ajoutait de la rhubarbe. On y retrouve un côté sucré et un côté surette. Un bel équilibre savamment exécuté. La bouche est bien meublée par ce liquide, bonne présence. Cette bière me réconforte. (193-240312)

Bottle from Beer Bistro.  Looks thick and brown in the glass.  Aroma of alcohol, sweet dark malts, and raisins.  Taste is sweet, with plenty of raisins and other dark fruits.  Big full body with nice carbonation.  Very good stuff!
On tap.  Pours a brown with a bit of head.  Aroma is overpowering.  It smells like champagne.  The taste continues with the aroma, fruity and extremely carbonated.  Very different and fantastic.

Found this bottle sitting in the coolers at firkin... Really not good at describing a beer of this caliber/complexity- all I can say is try it!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very complex beer. Dark color, sweet, a little bit bitter, hints of choclat, banana and full of taste. But his older brother Oerbier special reserva is still better!

On tap at the Brass Tap, poured a dark amber color with aromas of vanilla, bubble gum, resin and roast.  Bitter flavors hit the palate with a mix of cereal ,vanilla, and some feint fruit.  Interesting beer

330 ml bottle courtesy of Stefan. Pours slightly hazy reddish brown with a big fizzy caramel brown head that quickly dissipates without leaving any trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and tiny sour with dark bread, candi sugar, lemon zest, spices, yeasty esters, alcohol and hints of funk. Taste is sweet, tiny bitter and slightly sour with plums, orange zest, dark bread, yeasty esters, wood, hay, brown sugar, raspberry jam and hints of metallic phenols and alcohol. Mouthfeel is vinous, slightly creamy and medium to full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet and slightly sour with phenols, esters, hay and bread.

Just the reason why Ive first connected ratebeer, to find a coment about
this beer. What ? A score at 99 ? Im dreaming, or perhaps to much beer ....  Noooooo.  Its true.  A score without doubt. 
The dolle brouwers are completely crazy !! (OK its the meaning of their names !!! )  They do one of the best belgian beer, and they do nothing to put it a business on the market !!
The same thing in the States, ans you have a national co in 3 months,
and a cotation on Wallstreet !!!!  (Yes)
But its Belgium, a little land, so little you cannot see it on the map !!
(OK; its a world map !!!) And in Belgium , they do things as they think it
must go on, so.... No problem, we have a good beer more....
Blague à part, superbe bière, sans fausse note, a true musical score,
just as a song of Avantasia...
Arômes dabord de cidre classé, fût de chêne, sureau et réglisse. 
Première bouche sur un mix dOrval et Chimay rouge ... très belle entrée 
en matière... Disons : on peut faire plus mal !! En plus,  belle longueur.
Second nez très joli entre une trape et une ale .
Deuxième bouche dune belle bière "cossue". (La levure est très originale, mais ceci demanderait trop de commentaires ..)
Troisième bouche avec une pointe de lamertume des bières brunes
flamandes bien connues (Rodenbach, etc.), mais très fine et délicate.
Dans la longueur et la finale, beaucoup de tenue avec du côté vineux
et du porto (un peu, pas trop). Comme ils disent eux-mêmes, ce nest
pas petit, cest "nat en straf", cest-à-dire "wet and strong".
OK, je suis dautant plus daccord quil faut faire une remarque ......
IMPORTANTE : le degré alcoolique de cette bière est de 9 % abv, et 
non pas 7,5 , comme il est indiqué dans le "commercial description".
Preuve encore quen Belgique on est généreux, et que lon donne tout
ce que lon peut..... Merci aux Dolle (fous !!) pour cette merveille....
En résumé, 99 est trop peu, je passe à 100 (soyons modeste ...)

AROMA: bread, hay, nuts, herbs
APPEARANCE: brown, frothy then minimal
TASTE: light sweetness, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: full body, fizzy, slick feel, astringent, bitter, long finish
OVERALL: really well-balanced malty aromas hiding the alcohol well, very good finish with bitterness slowly replaced with malty aromas.
Buonissima! Dolciastra, fruttata, sentori di liquirizia e di ciliege. Tende quasi a una birra acida, ma il finale inaspettatamente "sgomma" verso quelle birre più luppolate. Semplicemente unica.

More mild than the Special Reserva counterpart, a bit sweeter with some cherry richness, much more like a Belgian Strong than the Reserva. I actually prefer this beer; its just more drinkable, the sourness isnt as prevalent.
Color marron oscuro y corona de espuma beige duradera, Mucha carbonatacion, aroma a toffe con sutiles toques a pan y azucar moreno. Sabor a caramelo muy maltoso y regusto alcoholico.

Rating #690, en flaske fra Toft Vin  

En rødbrun, næsten sort øl med en lille stabilt hvid-beige skum der har en virkelig god holdbarhed. Duften er kompleks med noter af vanille, pebernødder, solbær, hyldebær og ubestemmeligt mix af krydderier. Smagen er en tand lettere at udspecificere med vanille, pebernødder, brunkager, røde bær, kanel, en anelse af rødvin, træ og en mild bitterhed samt let alkohol. Medium tykkelse og tyngde. En rigtig god og anderledes belgier som dog virkelig ville have fået (jule)klokkerne til at ringe hvis den var en smule tykkere og mere cremet.

Pours a dark/amber colour with a thick head that quickly dissipates. Smells of strong alcohol and dark fruits. Tastes include mild alcohol, dark fruits. Enjoyable and complex beer, however it is certainly not a session beer and one to drink slowly to get all the flavours
Im not fan of belgium strong ale, and this is a typical example. strong biterness/sourness, dry palate
caramel, bread, earthy, red, hazy, rocky head, tan foam, heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, long finish, lively,

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Deep red-brown body capped by a creamy beige head that recedes fairly quickly before forming a thin, bubbly skim.  Spotty lacing.

S: Blast of Belgian yeast, complemented by raisins, cherries, molasses, vinous notes and a light underlying lactic tartness.

T: What I love about Oerbier is the ever changing flavor profile.  Each sip brings out new notes: dark fruits, rich sugars, vinous notes, yeast -- all wrapped in a nice gentle tart package.

M: Smooth, medium-full bodied, light tartness and acidity in the finish.

O: A great beer. This review was of a recent vintage that hasnt even fully opened up yet!  With age the tartness develops a bit more without diminishing the other flavors.

Hazed amber brown with a large, frothy, rocky light tan head. Aroma of dough, banana, light tart funk, molasses, dark fruit, citrus. Taste is sweet, tart, lots of yeast in here. Medium-full body, pretty high carbonation. Gets better as it warms, loses some carbonation, flavors seem more melded together. Very complex and the light tartness is very nice.
la gradazione alcolica inganna perchè è una birra che si fa bere abbastanza facilmente...
Aroma of raisin, funk, and overripe oranges.  Pours dusty brown with a tremendous foam.  Taste is very tart.  Orange zest, funk, dark fruits and a little bit of raw beef.   Very good Belgian.

En två år gammal flaska. Stor doft av mogna äpplen och jäst. Betydligt torrare än färsk. Alkoholen slår inte heller igen. Istället fruktig, lite träigt sträv, ganska frisk, mycket jästkaraktär och väldigt välbalanserad. Riktigt god.

33cl bottled april 2011. Dark red/brown with small tanned head. Nose : the smell is strong of alcohol and roasted malts. The dried raisins and vanilla. Caramel to coffee notes. It smells like a tart. Sip : the carbonation is strong and the density is low but creamy. Sweet with fruity ester notes. The alcohol is warming. Complex fruit aromas are dry and a bit sour. Overall the ending is a bit spicy and dry.

330ml bottle @ Viisi Penniä, Helsinki

Pours dark red with a small light brown head. Aroma of fruits, tart apples, malts and spices. Taste is quite carbonated with notes of red wine, tart apples, cherries, sweet malts and spices. Finish is warming, slightly bitter and fruity. Quite unusual, but tasty and well balanced.

Bottle from a friend. Strong alcohol aroma with date notes. The malts and yeast makes up most of the flavor, but also notes of orange peel, spice and black chai. The dark body and brown head provides a soft pillowy cushion for the beer. Really tasty.

Binnys LP 330ml ($6): Pours a brownish color with a light beige head. Aroma is of slightly roasty malts, Belgian yeast, dark frutiness, and a hint of booze. Taste is predictable, but still very much excellent. Balance is pulled off very well. Mouthfeel is slightly carbonated. Beer is a little warming as it goes down. Has some champagne-like qualities, although not as many as other De Dolle beers. Malts and yeast are the main attractions here and the hops are very subdued. The beer is slightly sweet, but very far from sugary. Aftertaste is there, but not all that much. Not my favourite De Dolle, but still quite good.
Draft at Brass Tap.  Dark pour.  Excellent aroma and flavor.  Fairly well hidden alcohol.

330ml bottle 
9.0% ABV (as written on the bottle) 
I tried this beer on January 20, 2012 at "The Beerbistro" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a medium dark brown with a huge tan head that was easily resurrected.  The aroma was dark malt, sugar, apples, and toffee.  The mouthfeel was light to medium bodied, with high carbonation.  The flavour is sweet malt, caramel, licorice, and fruit.

Deep reddish brown colour. Medium-sized off-white head. High carbonation level, and the texture is very fizzy. Rich and spicy aroma with notes of black pepper and cinnamon. Funky, but mostly sweet in the nose. Carbonation dominates the mouthfeel. Rich flavours. Sugars clearly used to make this beer. A little cloying perhaps, but overall an enjoyable beer.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2013 33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2010
Aroma is salty with licorice, herbs and spices. Also hints of metal. Flavour is rather unique and tart with citrus, flowery notes, salt, licorice and some warming alcohol. Dry finish. Really oer stuff.

Another bottle of the same batch
Quite the same, but licorice is not salty and this is more dry.

Bottle 33cl.
Pours a dark reddish colour with a good size head and normal carbonation.
Aroma is very malty and dry, some great fruity and raisin notes there too.
Flavour is very rich and balanced fruits.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber color with a disappearing white head. Aroma of dark fruit, sweet malt, candied cherries, alcohol and raisins. Taste is of dark fruit, raisins, alcohol and sweet malt with perfect carbonation. Delicious Belgium that lives up to the hype. Cool bottle and story as well to the beer.
Très bonne bière. Au nez fruits rouges cuits genre vieilles cerises. En bouche bière assez forte originale et agréable, mélange de caramel, sucre candy et fruits cuits.

Birra ambrata, sul rossiccio. Si presenta con una schiuma abbondante e non del tutto bianca, ha unaroma che ricorda le prugne secche. Al palato fa sentire tutta la sua dolcezza con presenza anche di fruttato e un pò di acidità. Birra molto complessa che nasconde abbastanza bene i suoi 10°

330 mL bottle at St. Veronus.  Hazy orange-brown with a nice light brown head.  Nice yeasty/spicy aroma also has some dried fruit.  The flavour is quite sweet, with caramel, spice, dried fruit, and candi sugar.  The booze, and perhaps hops, in the finish balance out the sweetness a bit.  Pretty tasty.

20/04/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Versione speciale realizzata con lieviti tipo Rodenbach. Ambrata scura con riflessi rossicci, abbastanza torbida, con buona schiuma bianco sporca. Aroma intenso, dolce, zuccheroso, di malto caramellato, lieviti, con intense note fruttate. In bocca è dolciastra, maltata, fruttata, con lieviti assoluti protagonisti e una bella evoluzione acida. Corpo pieno, struttura mastodontica, molto complessa. Meno dolciona della Oerbier tradizionale. Complessa, ruvida, contrastante.
Bottle in tulip glass. Dark brown, almost black colour with frothy off white head. Aroma is malty, dried fruit. Taste is malt, dried fruit, some bitterness in the end.

Refrigerated bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours medium brown with light brown highlights for the upper section, with medium tan head.  Very good lacing, medium body, and good carbonation.  Taste is candy sugar, some dark fruit (mostly raisin), and some hops in the finish.

33 cL bottle at Bar Volo, served in a snifter. Pours hazy reddish chestnut with a tall, dense head. The head remains and leaves a small amount of lace. On the nose, there are notes of fruit, raisins, figs, toasted malts, caramel, yeast, grass, earth and a bit of funk. The flavour begins intensely sweet with a huge brown sugar note, molasses, wood, flowers and spice. Through the middle, it develops a moderate bitterness to complement the opening. The finish is long, somewhat drier and spicy with wood and hops. On the palate, it is medium-full in body with a dryish texture, average carbonation and a hint of astringency. Overall, this is a great Belgian ale with a beautiful malty sweetness and delightful Belgian fruity and floral notes. Delicious. 2011-12-19

Very nice brown color with a nice big head. Malty aroma with dark fruits and maybe some sour cherries. The taste follow the aroma with more maltiness and dark fruits and finishes with a tart and slightly bitterness. Interesting, but not my favorite.

Pours an opaque deep amber/brown with a very thick tan head...nice lacing.  Aroma has some sweet dark fruit...raisin, fig...just a hint of funk.  Flavor is malty and slightly sweet with raisins and a hint of brown sugar and a pleasant mild tartness.  Mouthfeel is silky and the finish is malty with a sweet earthy note and slightly warming.

Served at a warm temperature with a nice foamy, light tan head and a little lace. Color is a cloudy brown amber. Aroma is heavy malt, raisins, figs, dates,  hint of molasses. Flavor is like nose, malt sweetness is on top, followed with the dark ripe fruit and carbonics. Body is perfect, ditto carbonation. Finish is like flavor, fairly long and balanced.
Fine head, cloudy chockolate coloured. Nose with sweet raisins, leather, orange curd. Medium body , long taste with high carb. Taste of orange and some dryness, a bit simple but easy to drink.

Dark amber with generous fluffy head. Aroma candymalt, dark fruits, chocolate, coffee. Taste sweet candymalt and dark fruits, coffee, alcohol some bitter chocolate, coffee, some sourness. Medium/full body, text sticky, finish with lasting bitterness, sourness and alcohol. To much of the alcohol. Perhaps better with some aging.

Bouteille de 33cl. Produit mythique gracieuseté de SlovakSniper (qui na pas tiré cette année!!!) Bière brune avec une mousse à grosses bulles beige foncé, elle est bruyante..cric, crac, croc...Effet du gaz carbonique à la belge. Le nez est impeccable avec ses effluves vineuses de fruits noirs, de prunes et de raisins. En bouche le liquide prend beaucoup de place, de lexpansion (belge ai-je dit ?). Les goûts de noix, de prunes et de raisins secs sefforcent pour nous faire apprécié cette bière qui malgré ses 9 degrés se laisse boire à grande lampé. Un classique!

Bottle.
Hazy ruby/brown with a big dirt white head that lace. Good looking beer.
Great complex sweet vinous aroma with cherries, prunes, oranges, apples and caramel. Also a bit spicy peppery with tobacco. Almond paste with rum.
Taste is also vinous (and sweet with some peppery tobacco notes. Toffee and caramel in the aftertaste.
Medium to bigger body with quite lively but moderate carbonation.
